member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve
member.summary: ArcCurve is used to represent arcs and circles. ArcCurve.IsCircle returns true if the curve is a complete circle. Details: an ArcCurve is a subcurve of a circle, with a constant speed parameterization. The parameterization is an affine linear reparameterzation of the underlying arc m_arc onto the domain m_t. A valid ArcCurve has Radius()>0 and 0<AngleRadians()<=2*PI and a strictly increasing Domain().

member.summary: Gets a Box whose base plane and axis dimensions are all Unset.

member.summary: Gets the validity of this Box. Boxes are invalid when the base plane or any of the dimension intervals are invalid or decreasing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation plane for this Box.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Box.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the Interval that describes the dimension of the Box along the orientation plane X-Axis. Otherwise known as the Width of the Box.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Box.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Interval that describes the dimension of the Box along the orientation plane Y-Axis. Otherwise known as the Depth of the Box.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Box.Z
member.summary: Gets or sets the Interval that describes the dimension of the Box along the orientation plane Z-Axis. Otherwise known as the Height of the Box.

member.summary: Gets the point that is in the center of the box.

Unitized parameter along Box Z direction.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType
member.summary: Enumerates all possible Loft types.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Normal
member.summary: Uses chord-length parameterization in the loft direction

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Loose
member.summary: The surface is allowed to move away from the original curves to make a smoother surface. The surface control points are created at the same locations as the control points of the loft input curves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Tight
member.summary: The surface sticks closely to the original curves. Uses square root of chord-length parameterization in the loft direction

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Straight
member.summary: The sections between the curves are straight. This is also known as a ruled surface.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Developable
member.summary: Creates a separate developable surface or polysurface from each pair of curves.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Brep
member.summary: Boundary Representation. A surface or polysurface along with trim curve information.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsSolid
member.summary: Test Brep to see if it is a solid. (A "solid" is a closed oriented manifold.)

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.SolidOrientation
member.summary: Gets the Solid orientation state of this Brep.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsManifold
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the Brep is Manifold. Non-Manifold breps have at least one edge that is shared among three or more faces.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsSurface
member.summary: Returns true if the Brep has a single face and that face is geometrically the same as the underlying surface. I.e., the face has trivial trimming. In this case, the surface is m_S[0]. The flag m_F[0].m_bRev records the correspondence between the surface's natural parametric orientation and the orientation of the Brep.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.TryConvertBrep(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase)
member.summary: Attempts to convert a generic Geometry object into a Brep.
member.param: Geometry to convert, not all types of GeometryBase can be represented by BReps.
member.returns: Brep if a brep form could be created or null if this is not possible. If geometry was of type Brep to begin with, the same object is returned, i.e. it is not duplicated.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreateTrimmedSurface(Rhino.Geometry.BrepFace,Rhino.Geometry.Surface)
member.summary: Create a Brep using the trimming information of a brep face and a surface. Surface must be roughly the same shape and in the same location as the trimming brep face.
member.param: Surface that trims of BrepFace will be applied to.
member.returns: A brep with the shape of surfaceSource and the trims of trimSource or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CopyTrimCurves(Rhino.Geometry.BrepFace,Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Double)
member.summary: Copy all trims from a Brep face onto a surface.
member.param: Brep face which defines the trimming curves.
Tolerance to use for rebuilding 3D trim curves.
member.returns: A brep with the shape of surfaceSource and the trims of trimSource or null on failure.

member.summary: Create new Brep from 8 corner points

if true end at cylinder.m_height[1] should be capped

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreateFromLoft(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.LoftType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates one or more Breps by lofting through a set of curves.
member.param: The curves to loft through. This function will not perform any curve sorting. You must pass in curves in the order you want them lofted. This function will not adjust the directions of open curves. Use Curve.DoDirectionsMatch and Curve.Reverse to adjust the directions of open curves. This function will not adjust the seams of closed curves. Use Curve.ChangeClosedCurveSeam to adjust the seam of closed curves.
Optional starting point of loft. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include a start point
Optional ending point of loft. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include an end point
member.returns: Creates a closed surface, continuing the surface past the last curve around to the first curve. Available when you have selected three shape curves

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreateFromLoftRebuild(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.LoftType,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates one or more Breps by lofting through a set of curves. Input for the loft is simplified by rebuilding to a specified number of control points.
member.param: The curves to loft through. This function will not perform any curve sorting. You must pass in curves in the order you want them lofted. This function will not adjust the directions of open curves. Use Curve.DoDirectionsMatch and Curve.Reverse to adjust the directions of open curves. This function will not adjust the seams of closed curves. Use Curve.ChangeClosedCurveSeam to adjust the seam of closed curves.
Optional starting point of loft. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include a start point
Optional ending point of lost. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include an end point
member.returns: Creates a closed surface, continuing the surface past the last curve around to the first curve. Available when you have selected three shape curves

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreateFromLoftRefit(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.LoftType,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates one or more Breps by lofting through a set of curves. Input for the loft is simplified by refitting to a specified tolerance
member.param: The curves to loft through. This function will not perform any curve sorting. You must pass in curves in the order you want them lofted. This function will not adjust the directions of open curves. Use Curve.DoDirectionsMatch and Curve.Reverse to adjust the directions of open curves. This function will not adjust the seams of closed curves. Use Curve.ChangeClosedCurveSeam to adjust the seam of closed curves.
Optional starting point of loft. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include a start point
Optional ending point of lost. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include an end point
member.returns: Creates a closed surface, continuing the surface past the last curve around to the first curve. Available when you have selected three shape curves

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.GetClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: This method is Obsolete, use ClosestPoint() instead.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Finds a point on a brep that is closest to testPoint.
member.param: base point to project to surface
location of the closest brep point
Component index of the brep component that contains the closest point. Possible types are brep_face, brep_edge or brep_vertex
If the ci type is brep_edge, then s is the parameter of the closest edge point.
If the ci type is brep_face, then (s,t) is the parameter of the closest edge point.
If maximumDistance > 0, then only points whose distance is <= maximumDistance will be returned. Using a positive value of maximumDistance can substantially speed up the search.
The normal to the face if ci is a brep_face and the tangent to the edge if ci is brep_edge.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsPointInside(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determine if a 3D point is inside of a brep. This function only makes sense for closed manifold Breps.
member.param: 3d distance tolerance used for intersection and determining strict inclusion. A good default is RhinoMath.SqrtEpsilon
if true, point is in if inside brep by at least tolerance. if false, point is in if truly in or within tolerance of boundary.
member.returns: true if point is in, false if not

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.Flip
member.summary: Reverses entire brep orientation of all faces.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CapPlanarHoles(System.Double)
member.summary: Return a new Brep that is equivalent to this Brep with all planar holes capped.
member.returns: New brep on success. null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.Join(Rhino.Geometry.Brep,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If any edges of this brep overlap edges of otherBrep, merge a copy of otherBrep into this brep joining all edges that overlap within tolerance
member.param: Brep to be added to this brep
3d distance tolerance for detecting overlapping edges
if true, set brep flags and tolerances, remove unused faces and edges
member.returns: true if any edges were joined
member.remarks: if no edges overlap, this brep is unchanged. otherBrep is copied if it is merged with this, and otherBrep is always unchanged Use this to join a list of breps in a series. When joining multiple breps in series, compact should be set to false. Call compact on the last Join

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepFace.TrimAwareIsoCurve(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Similar to IsoCurve function, except this function pays attention to trims on faces and may return multiple curves.
member.param:
Direction of isocurve.
0 = Isocurve connects all points with a constant U value.
1 = Isocurve connects all points with a constant V value.
Surface parameter that remains identical along the isocurves.
member.returns: Isoparametric curves connecting all points with the constantParameter value.
member.remarks: In this function "direction" indicates which direction the resulting curve runs. 0: horizontal, 1: vertical In the other Surface functions that take a "direction" argument, "direction" indicates if "constantParameter" is a "u" or "v" parameter.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Hatch
member.summary: Represents a hatch in planar boundary loop or loops. This is a 2d entity with a plane defining a local coordinate system. The loops, patterns, angles, etc are all in this local coordinate system. The Hatch object manages the plane and loop array Fill definitions are in the HatchPattern or class derived from HatchPattern Hatch has an index to get the pattern definition from the pattern table

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineLine(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Line,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Intersect two lines.
member.param: Parameter on lineA that is closest to LineB. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
Parameter on lineB that is closest to LineA. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
If tolerance > 0.0, then an intersection is reported only if the distance between the points is <= tolerance. If tolerance <= 0.0, then the closest point between the lines is reported.
If True, the input lines are treated as finite segments. If False, the input lines are treated as infinite lines.
member.returns: True if a closest point can be calculated and the result passes the tolerance parameter test.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineLine(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Line,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Find the closest point between two infinite lines.
member.param: Parameter on lineA that is closest to lineB. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
Parameter on lineB that is closest to lineA. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
member.returns:
True if points are found and false if the lines are numerically parallel. Numerically parallel means the 2x2 matrix:
+AoA -AoB
-AoB +BoB is numerically singular, where A = (lineA.To - lineA.From) and B = (lineB.To-lineB.From)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LinePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Double@)
member.summary: Intersect a line and a plane. This function only returns true if the intersection result is a single point (i.e. if the line is coincident with the plane then no intersection is assumed).
member.param: Parameter on line where intersection occurs. If the parameter is not within the {0, 1} Interval then the finite segment does not intersect the plane.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlanePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Line@)
member.summary: Intersect two planes and return the intersection line. If the planes are parallel or coincident, no intersection is assumed.
member.param: If this function returns true, the intersectionLine parameter will return the line where the planes intersect.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlanePlanePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersect three planes to find the single point they all share.
member.param: Point where all three planes converge.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure. If at least two out of the three planes are parallel or coincident, there will be no solution.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent
member.summary: Provides all the information for a single Curve Intersection event.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.IsPoint
member.summary: All curve intersection events are either a single point or an overlap

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.IsOverlap
member.summary: All curve intersection events are either a single point or an overlap

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.PointA
member.summary: Gets the point on Curve A where the intersection occured. If the intersection type is overlap, then this will return the start of the overlap region.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.PointA2
member.summary: Gets the end point of the overlap on Curve A. If the intersection type is not overlap, this value is meaningless.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.PointB
member.summary: Gets the point on Curve B (or Surface B) where the intersection occured. If the intersection type is overlap, then this will return the start of the overlap region.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.PointB2
member.summary: Gets the end point of the overlap on Curve B (or Surface B). If the intersection type is not overlap, this value is meaningless.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.ParameterA
member.summary: Gets the parameter on Curve A where the intersection occured. If the intersection type is overlap, then this will return the start of the overlap region.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.ParameterB
member.summary: Gets the parameter on Curve A where the intersection occured. If the intersection type is overlap, then this will return the start of the overlap region.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.OverlapA
member.summary: Gets the interval on curve A where the overlap occurs. If the intersection type is not overlap, this value is meaningless.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.OverlapB
member.summary: Gets the interval on curve B where the overlap occurs. If the intersection type is not overlap, this value is meaningless.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.SurfacePointParameter(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: If this instance records a Curve|Surface intersection event, and the intersection type is point, then use this function to get the U and V parameters on the surface where the intersection occurs.
member.param: Parameter on surface u direction where the intersection occurs.
Parameter on surface v direction where the intersection occurs.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.SurfaceOverlapParameter(Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@)
member.summary: If this instance records a Curve|Surface intersection event, and the intersection type if overlap, then use this function to get the U and V domains on the surface where the overlap occurs.
member.param: Domain along surface U direction for overlap event.
Domain along surface V direction for overlap event.

member.summary: Turn light on or off

member.summary: Determined by LightStyle

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SpotAngleRadians
member.summary: ignored for non-spot lights angle = 0 to pi/2 (0 to 90 degrees)

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SpotExponent
member.summary: The spot exponent varies from 0.0 to 128.0 and provides an exponential interface for controling the focus or concentration of a spotlight (like the OpenGL GL_SPOT_EXPONENT parameter). The spot exponent and hot spot parameters are linked; changing one will change the other. A hot spot setting of 0.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 128. A hot spot setting of 1.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 0.0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.HotSpot
member.summary: The hot spot setting runs from 0.0 to 1.0 and is used to provides a linear interface for controling the focus or concentration of a spotlight. A hot spot setting of 0.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 128. A hot spot setting of 1.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 0.0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.Length
member.summary: linear and rectangular light parameter (ignored for non-linear/rectangular lights)

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.Width
member.summary: linear and rectangular light parameter (ignored for non-linear/rectangular lights)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SetAttenuation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: attenuation settings (ignored for "directional" and "ambient" lights) attenuation = 1/(a0 + d*a1 + d^2*a2) where d = distance to light

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Light.GetAttenuation(System.Double)
member.summary: attenuation settings (ignored for "directional" and "ambient" lights) attenuation = 1/(a0 + d*a1 + d^2*a2) where d = distance to light

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.Area
member.summary: Gets the area solution.

member.summary: Gets the uncertainty in the area calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.Centroid
member.summary: Gets the area centroid in the world coordinate system.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidError
member.summary: Gets the uncertainty in the centroid calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesFirstMoments
member.summary: Returns the world coordinate first moments if they were able to be calculated. X is integral of "x dm" over the area Y is integral of "y dm" over the area Z is integral of "z dm" over the area

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesFirstMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates first moments calculation

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesSecondMoments
member.summary: Returns the world coordinate first moments if they were able to be calculated. X is integral of "xx dm" over the area Y is integral of "yy dm" over the area Z is integral of "zz dm" over the area

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesSecondMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates second moments calculation

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesProductMoments
member.summary: Returns the world coordinate product moments if they were able to be calculated. X is integral of "xy dm" over the area Y is integral of "yz dm" over the area Z is integral of "zx dm" over the area

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesProductMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates second moments calculation

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesMomentsOfInertia
member.summary: The moments of inertia about the world coordinate axes. X = integral of (y^2 + z^2) dm Y = integral of (z^2 + x^2) dm Z = integral of (z^2 + y^2) dm
member.remarks: What is meant by "moments of intertia" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Summary section. Some applications may want the values from WorldCoordinatesSecondMoments instead of the values returned here.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesMomentsOfInertiaError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates moments of inertia calculation

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesRadiiOfGyration
member.summary: Radii of gyration with respect to world coordinate system. X = sqrt(integral of (y^2 + z^2) dm/M) Y = sqrt(integral of (z^2 + x^2) dm/M) Z = sqrt(integral of (z^2 + y^2) dm/M)
member.remarks: What is meant by "radii of gyration" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Returns section.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesSecondMoments
member.summary: Second moments with respect to centroid coordinate system. X = integral of (x-x0)^2 dm Y = integral of (y-y0)^2 dm Z = integral of (z-z0)^2 dm where (x0,y0,z0) = centroid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesSecondMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in centroid coordinates second moments calculation

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesMomentsOfInertia
member.summary: Moments of inertia with respect to centroid coordinate system. X = integral of ((y-y0)^2 + (z-z0)^2) dm Y = integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (x-x0)^2) dm Z = integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (y-y0)^2) dm where (x0,y0,z0) = centroid.
member.remarks: What is meant by "moments of intertia" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Summary section. Some applications may want the values from WorldCoordinatesSecondMoments instead of the values returned here.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesMomentsOfInertiaError
member.summary: Uncertainty in centroid coordinates moments of inertia calculation

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesRadiiOfGyration
member.summary: Radii of gyration with respect to centroid coordinate system. X = sqrt(integral of ((y-y0)^2 + (z-z0)^2) dm/M) Y = sqrt(integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (x-x0)^2) dm/M) Z = sqrt(integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (y-y0)^2) dm/M) where (x0,y0,z0) = centroid.
member.remarks: What is meant by "radii of gyration" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Returns section.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters
member.summary: Settings used for creating a Mesh representation of a Brep

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initial values are same as "Default"

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Minimal
member.summary: Gets minimal meshing parameters

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Default
member.summary: Gets default meshing parameters

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Coarse
member.summary: Gets meshing parameters for coarse meshing. This corresponds with the "Jagged and Faster" default in Rhino.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Smooth
member.summary: Gets meshing parameters for smooth meshing. This corresponds with the "Smooth and Slower" default in Rhino.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.JaggedSeams
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the mesh is allowed to have jagged seams. When this flag is set to True, meshes on either side of a Brep Edge will not match up.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.RefineGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the sampling grid can be refined when certain tolerances are not met.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.SimplePlanes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not planar areas are allowed to be meshed in a simplified manner.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.ComputeCurvature
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not surface curvature data will be embedded in the mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridMinCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of grid quads in the initial sampling grid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridMaxCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of grid quads in the initial sampling grid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed angle difference (in radians) for a single sampling quad. The angle pertains to the surface normals.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed aspect ratio of sampling quads.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.GridAmplification
member.summary: Gets or sets the grid amplification factor. Values lower than 1.0 will decrease the number of initial quads, values higher than 1.0 will increase the number of initial quads.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Tolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed edge deviation. This tolerance is measured between the center of the mesh edge and the surface.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.MinimumTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum tolerance.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.RelativeTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative tolerance.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.MinimumEdgeLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowed mesh edge length.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.MaximumEdgeLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed mesh edge length.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsManifold(System.Boolean,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the mesh is manifold. A manifold mesh does not have any "edges" that are part of three or more faces.
member.param: If true, the query treats coincident vertices as the same.
isOriented will be set to True if the mesh is a manifold and adjacent faces have compatible face normals.
hasBoundary will be set to True if the mesh is a manifold and there is at least one "edge" with no more than one adjacent face.
member.returns: True if every mesh "edge" has at most two adjacent faces.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Compact
member.summary: Removes any unreferenced objects from arrays, reindexes as needed and shrinks arrays to minimum required size.

member.summary: Reverses the direction of the mesh.

If True, face orientations will be reversed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ExplodeAtUnweldedEdges
member.summary: Explode the mesh into submeshes where a submesh is a collection of faces that are contained within a closed loop of "unwelded" edges. Unwelded edges are edges where the faces that share the edge have unique mesh vertexes (not mesh topology vertexes) at both ends of the edge.
member.returns: Array of submeshes on success; null on error. If the count in the returned array is 1, then nothing happened and the ouput is essentially a copy of the input.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh)

member.param: Mesh to append to this one.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Get the point on the mesh that is closest to a given test point.
member.returns: The point on the mesh closest to testPoint, or Point3d.Unset on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.GetClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,System.Double)
member.summary: This method is Obsolete, use ClosestPoint() instead.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,System.Double)
member.summary: Get the point on the mesh that is closest to a given test point.
member.param: Point on the mesh closest to testPoint.

Optional upper bound on the distance from test point to the mesh. If you are only interested in finding a point Q on the mesh when testPoint.DistanceTo(Q) < maximumDistance, then set maximumDistance to that value. This parameter is ignored if you pass 0.0 for a maximumDistance.
member.returns: Index of face that the closest point lies on if successful. -1 if not successful; the value of pointOnMesh is undefined.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.GetClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@,System.Double)
member.summary: This method is Obsolete, use ClosestPoint() instead.

member.summary: Get the point on the mesh that is closest to a given test point.
member.param: Point on the mesh closest to testPoint.
The normal vector of the mesh at the closest point.

Optional upper bound on the distance from test point to the mesh. If you are only interested in finding a point Q on the mesh when testPoint.DistanceTo(Q) < maximumDistance, then set maximumDistance to that value. This parameter is ignored if you pass 0.0 for a maximumDistance.
member.returns: Index of face that the closest point lies on if successful. -1 if not successful; the value of pointOnMesh is undefined.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexList.SetVertex(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets or adds a vertex to the Vertex List.
If [index] is less than [Count], the existing vertex at [index] will be modified.
If [index] equals [Count], a new vertex is appended to the end of the vertex list.
If [index] is larger than [Count], the function will return false.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.ConvertTrianglesToQuads(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Joins adjacent triangles into quads if the resulting quad is 'nice'.
member.param: Used to compare adjacent triangles' face normals. For two triangles to be considered, the angle between their face normals has to be <= angleToleranceRadians. When in doubt use RhinoMath.PI/90.0 (2 degrees).

( <= 1.0) For two triangles to be considered the ratio of the resulting quad's diagonals (length of the shortest diagonal)/(length of longest diagonal). has to be >= minimumDiagonalLengthRatio. When in doubt us .875.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.returns: The number of degenerate faces that were removed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.Clear
member.summary: Clear the Vertex Color list on the mesh.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.Add(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new vertex color to the end of the Color list.
member.param: Red component of color, must be in the 0~255 range.
Green component of color, must be in the 0~255 range.
Blue component of color, must be in the 0~255 range.
member.returns: The index of the newly added color.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.Add(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Adds a new vertex color to the end of the Color list.
member.param: Color to append, Alpha channels will be ignored.
member.returns: The index of the newly added color.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.SetColor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets or adds a vertex color to the Color List.
If [index] is less than [Count], the existing vertex at [index] will be modified.
If [index] equals [Count], a new vertex is appended to the end of the vertex list.
If [index] is larger than [Count], the function will return false.
member.param: Index of vertex color to set. If index equals Count, then the color will be appended.
Red component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
Green component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
Blue component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.SetColor(System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary:
Sets or adds a vertex to the Vertex List.
If [index] is less than [Count], the existing vertex at [index] will be modified.
If [index] equals [Count], a new vertex is appended to the end of the vertex list.
If [index] is larger than [Count], the function will return false.
member.param: Index of vertex color to set. If index equals Count, then the color will be appended.
Color to set, Alpha channels will be ignored.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.CreateMonotoneMesh(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Create a valid vertex color list consisting of a single color.
member.param: Color to apply to every vertex.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.SetColors(System.Drawing.Color[])
member.summary: Set all the vertex colors in one go. For the Mesh to be valid, the number of colors must match the number of vertices.
member.returns: True on success, False on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshVertexColorList.AppendColors(System.Drawing.Color[])
member.summary: Append a collection of colors to the Vertex Color list. For the Mesh to be valid, the number of colors must match the number of vertices.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new triangular Mesh face.

member.summary: Create a new quadrangular Mesh face.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Unset
member.summary: Gets an Unset MeshFace. Unset faces have Int32.MinValue for all corner indices.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.DebuggerDisplayUtil
member.summary: Internal property that figures out the debugger display for Mesh Faces.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the first corner index of the mesh face.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.B
member.summary: Gets or sets the second corner index of the mesh face.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.C
member.summary: Gets or sets the third corner index of the mesh face.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.D
member.summary: Gets or sets the fourth corner index of the mesh face. If D equals C, the mesh face is considered to be a triangle rather than a quad.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsTriangle
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is a triangle. A mesh face is considered to be a triangle when C equals D, thus it is possible for an Invalid mesh face to also be a triangle.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsQuad
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is a quad. A mesh face is considered to be a triangle when C does not equal D, thus it is possible for an Invalid mesh face to also be a quad.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Note that even valid mesh faces could potentially be invalid in the context of a specific Mesh, if one or more of the corner indices exceeds the number of vertices on the mesh. If you want to perform a complete validity check, use IsValid(int) instead.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes upper bound indices into account.
member.param: Number of vertices in the mesh that this face is a part of.
member.returns: True if the face is considered valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Set(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set all the corners for this face as a triangle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Set(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set all the corners for this face as a quad.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Flip
member.summary: Reverses the orientation of the face by swapping corners. The first corner is always maintained.

member.name: M:Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject.EnsurePrivateCopy
member.summary: If you want to keep a copy of this class around by holding onto it in a variable after a command completes, call EnsurePrivateCopy to make sure that this class is not tied to the document. You can call this function as many times as you want.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not a PolyCurve contains nested PolyCurves.

member.summary: This is a quick way to see if the curve has gaps between the sub curve segments.

member.summary: Duplicate this Polycurve.

member.summary: Get the segment curve at the given index.
member.returns: The segment at the given index or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.RemoveNesting
member.summary: Explodes nested polycurve segments and reconstructs this curve from the shattered remains. The result will have not have any PolyCurves as segments but it will have identical locus and parameterization.
member.returns: True if any nested PolyCurve was found and absorbed, false if no PolyCurve segments could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Explode
member.summary: Explode this PolyCurve into a list of Curve segments. This will not explode nested PolyCurves. Place a call to RemoveNesting() first if you want all individual segments.
member.returns: An array of polycurve segments.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Line)
member.summary: Append and match the start of the line to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the PolyCurve is closed.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Arc)
member.summary: Append and match the start of the arc to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the PolyCurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the arc is closed.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Curve)
member.summary: Append and match the start of the curve to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the PolyCurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the new segment is closed.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentCurveParameter(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a polycurve parameter to a segment curve parameter.
member.returns: Segment curve evaluation parameter or UnsetValue if the segment curve parameter could not be computed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.PolyCurveParameter(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a segment curve parameter to a polycurve parameter.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentDomain(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the polycurve subdomain assigned to a segment curve.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentIndex(System.Double)
member.summary: Find the segment used for evaluation at polycurve_parameter.
member.param: Parameter on polycurve for segment lookup.
member.returns: Index of the segment used for evaluation at polycurve_parameter. If polycurve_parameter < Domain.Min(), then 0 is returned. If polycurve_parameter > Domain.Max(), then Count()-1 is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentIndexes(Rhino.Geometry.Interval,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Find the segments that overlap the Polycurve sub domain.
member.param: Index of first segment that overlaps the subdomain.
Index of last segment that overlaps the subdomain. Note that segmentIndex0 <= i < segmentIndex1.
member.returns: Number of segments that overlap the subdomain.

member.summary: Remove all points that are closer than tolerance to the previous point. Start and end points are left intact.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.CollapseShortSegments(System.Double)
member.summary: Collapse all segments until none are shorter than tolerance. This function is significantly slower than DeleteShortSegments, since it recursively operates on the shortest segment. When a segment is collapsed the end-points are placed in the center of the segment.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.GetNextDiscontinuity(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Search for a derivative, tangent, or curvature discontinuity.
member.param: If 0, then "u" parameter is checked. If 1, then the "v" parameter is checked.
Search begins at t0. If there is a discontinuity at t0, it will be ignored. This makes it possible to repeatedly call GetNextDiscontinuity and step through the discontinuities.
(t0 != t1) If there is a discontinuity at t1 is will be ingored unless c is a locus discontinuity type and t1 is at the start or end of the curve.
if a discontinuity is found, then t reports the parameter at the discontinuity.
member.returns: Parametric continuity tests c = (C0_continuous, ..., G2_continuous): TRUE if a parametric discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1. Note well that all curves are parametrically continuous at the ends of their domains. Locus continuity tests c = (C0_locus_continuous, ...,G2_locus_continuous): TRUE if a locus discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1 or at t1 is the at the end of a curve. Note well that all open curves (IsClosed()=false) are locus discontinuous at the ends of their domains. All closed curves (IsClosed()=true) are at least C0_locus_continuous at the ends of their domains.

member.summary: Get isoparametric curve.
member.param: 0 first parameter varies and second parameter is constant e.g., point on IsoCurve(0,c) at t is srf(t,c) This is a horizontal line from left to right 1 first parameter is constant and second parameter varies e.g., point on IsoCurve(1,c) at t is srf(c,t This is a vertical line from bottom to top
member.returns: Isoparametric curve
member.remarks: In this function "direction" indicates which direction the resulting curve runs. 0: horizontal, 1: vertical In the other Surface functions that take a "direction" argument, "direction" indicates if "constantParameter" is a "u" or "v" parameter.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.HasNurbsForm
member.summary: Is there a NURBS surface representation of this surface.
member.returns: 0 unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy. 1 success - NURBS parameterization matches the surface's 2 success - NURBS point locus matches the surface's and the domain of the NURBS surface is correct. However, This surface's parameterization and the NURBS surface parameterization may not match. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of surfaces that have a transendental parameterization like spheres, cylinders, and cones.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.ToNurbsSurface
member.summary: Get a NURBS surface representation of this surface. Default tolerance of 0.0 is used.
member.returns: NurbsSurface on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.ToNurbsSurface(System.Double,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get a NURBS surface representation of this surface.
member.param: tolerance to use when creating NURBS representation.

param.name: accuracy
param.para: 0 = unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy.
1 = success - returned NURBS parameterization matches the surface's to the desired accuracy

2 = success - returned NURBS point locus matches the surface's to the desired accuracy and the domain of the NURBS surface is correct. However, this surface's parameterization and the NURBS surface parameterization may not match to the desired accuracy. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of surfaces that have a transendental parameterization like spheres, cylinders, and cones.

member.returns: NurbsSurface on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsPlanar
member.summary: Test a surface to see if it is planar to zero tolerance
member.returns: True if the surface is planar (flat) to within RhinoMath.ZeroTolerance units (1e-12).

member.summary: Test a surface to see if it is planar to a given tolerance.
member.returns: true if there is a plane such that the maximum distance from the surface to the plane is <= tolerance.

member.param: On success, the plane parameters are filled in.
member.returns: True if there is a plane such that the maximum distance from the surface to the plane is <= RhinoMath.ZeroTolerance.

member.summary: Test a surface for planarity and return the plane.
member.param: On success, the plane parameters are filled in.
member.returns: True if there is a plane such that the maximum distance from the surface to the plane is <= tolerance.

member.summary: Copy all the numbers from an existing RhinoList.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the values inside this Interpolator are to be treated as cyclical (i.e. circular).

member.returns: The sampled value at t.

member.summary: Sample the list of numbers with Catmull-Rom interpolation.

member.returns: The sampled value at t.

member.summary: Map a sample index onto the actual sample list.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL
member.summary: Represents an HSL (Hue, Saturation, Luminance) color with double precision floating point channels. HSL colors are used primarily in Graphical User Interface environments as they provide a very natural approach to picking colors.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.#ctor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Create a new instance of ColorHSL that is equivalent to an RGB color.
member.remarks: Exact conversions between color spaces are often not possible.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a new instance of ColorHSL with custom channel values.
member.param: Hue channel value. Hue channels rotate between 0.0 and 1.0
Saturation channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.
Luminance channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a new instance of ColorHSL with custom channel values.
member.param: Alpha channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.
Hue channel value. Hue channels rotate between 0.0 and 1.0
Saturation channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.
Luminance channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.

member.name: F:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.m_a
member.summary: Alpha values are inverted internally! 0 = opaque; 1 = transparent.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.H
member.summary: Gets or sets the hue channel value. Hue channels rotate between 0.0 and 1.0

member.summary: Gets or sets the saturation channel value. Saturation channels are limited to a 0~1 range.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.L
member.summary: Gets or sets the luminance channel value. Luminance channels are limited to a 0~1 range.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha channel value. Alpha channels are limited to a 0~1 range.

member.returns: The HSL equivalent of the CMYK color.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ColorLCH
member.summary: Represents an LCH (Lightness, A, B) color with double precision floating point channels. LCH colors (also sometimes called CIELUV) are transformation of the 1931 CIE XYZ color space, in order to approach perceptual uniformity. They are primarily used in computer graphics which deal with colored lights.

member.remarks: Exact conversions between color spaces are often not possible.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline
member.summary:
The display pipeline calls events during specific phases of drawing During the drawing of a single frame the events are called in the following order
[Begin Drawing of a Frame]
CalculateBoundingBox
CalculateClippingPanes
SetupFrustum
SetupLighting
InitializeFrameBuffer
DrawBackground
If this is a layout and detail objects exist the channels are called in the same order for each detail object (drawn as a nested viewport)
PreDrawObjects
For Each Visible Non Highlighted Object
SetupObjectDisplayAttributes
PreDrawObject
DrawObject
PostDrawObject
PostDrawObjects - depth writing/testing on
DrawForeGround - depth writing/testing off
For Each Visible Highlighted Object
SetupObjectDisplayAttributes
PreDrawObject
DrawObject
PostDrawObject
PostProcessFrameBuffer (If a delegate exists that requires this)
DrawOverlay (if Rhino is in a feedback mode) [End of Drawing of a Frame]
NOTE: There may be multiple DrawObject calls for a single object. An example of when this could happen would be with a shaded sphere. The shaded mesh is first drawn and these channels would be processed; then at a later time the isocurves for the sphere would be drawn.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.PostDrawObjects
member.summary: Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn. Depth writing and testing are still turned on. If you want to draw without depth writing/testing, see DrawForeground

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawForeground
member.summary: Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn and PostDrawObjects has been called. Depth writing and testing are turned OFF. If you want to draw with depth writing/testing, see PostDrawObjects

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawOverlay
member.summary: If Rhino is in a feedback mode, the draw overlay call allows for temporary geometry to be drawn on top of everything in the scene. This is similar to the dynamic draw routine that occurs with custom get point.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.FrameSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the framebuffer that this pipeline is drawing to.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DefaultCurveThickness
member.summary: Gets the curve thickness as defined by the current display mode. Note: this only applies to curve objects, Brep and Mesh wires may have different settings.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsOpenGL
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this pipeline is drawing into an OpenGL context.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsStereoMode
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this pipeline is currently using an engine that is performing stereo style drawing. Stereo drawing is for providing an "enhanced 3-D" effect through stereo viewing devices.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsPrinting
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this pipeline is currently drawing for printing purposes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsDynamicDisplay
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the viewport is in Dynamic Display state. Dynamic display is the state a viewport is in when it is rapidly redrawing because of an operation like panning or rotating. The pipeline will drop some level of detail while inside a dynamic display state to keep the frame rate as high as possible.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.SupportsShading
member.summary: Gets whether or not this pipeline supports shaded meshes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.StereoProjection
member.summary:
Get the current stereo projection if stereo mode is on.
0 = left
1 = right If stereo mode is not enables, this property always returns 0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ModelTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets the current model transformation that is applied to vertices when drawing.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ModelTransformIsIdentity
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the Model Transform is an Identity transformation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.RenderPass
member.summary: Gets the current pass that the pipeline is in for drawing a frame. Typically drawing a frame requires a single pass through the DrawFrameBuffer function, but some special display effects can be achieved through drawing with multiple passes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.NestLevel
member.summary:
Gets the current nested viewport drawing level. This is used to know if you are currently inside the drawing of a nested viewport (detail object in Rhino).
Nest level = 0 Drawing is occuring in a standard Rhino viewport or on the page viewport.
Nest level = 1 Drawing is occuring inside a detail view object.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawingWires
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pipeline is currently in a curve drawing operation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawingGrips
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pipeline is currently in a grip drawing operation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ShadingRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets the "ShadingRequired" flag. This flag gets set inside the pipeline when a request is made to draw a shaded mesh but the current render engine doesn't support shaded mesh drawing...at this point the redraw mechanism will make sure everything will work the next time around.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Test a given 3d world coordinate point for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings.
member.returns: True if the point is visible, false if it is not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary: Test a given object for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings. This function calls a virtual IsVisibleFinal function that subclassed pipelines can add extra tests to. In the base class, this test only tests visibility based on the objects world coordinates location and does not pay attention to the object's attributes. NOTE: Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsVisible() to perform "visibility" tests based on location (is some part of the object in the view frustum). Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsActive() to perform "visibility" tests based on object type.
member.returns: True if the object is visible, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Test a given box for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings.
member.returns: True if at least some portion of the box is visible, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsActive(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary: Determines if an object can be visible in this viewport based on it's object type and display attributes. This test does not check for visibility based on location of the object. NOTE: Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsVisible() to perform "visibility" tests based on location (is some part of the object in the view frustum). Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsActive() to perform "visibility" tests based on object type.
member.returns: True if this object can be drawn in the pipeline's viewport based on it's object type and display attributes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.InterruptDrawing
member.summary: Tests to see if the pipeline should stop drawing more geometry and just show what it has so far. If a drawing operation is taking a long time, this function will return true and tell Rhino it should just finish up and show the frame buffer. This is used in dynamic drawing operations.
member.returns: True if the pipeline should stop attempting to draw more geometry and just show the frame buffer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawToBitmap(Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw a given viewport to an off-screen bitmap.
member.returns: A bitmap containing the given view, or null on error.

member.name: T:Rhino.RhinoDoc
member.summary: Represents an active model

member.name: E:Rhino.RhinoDoc.AddRhinoObject
member.summary: Called if a new object is added to the document

member.name: E:Rhino.RhinoDoc.DeleteRhinoObject
member.summary: Called if an object is deleted. At some later point the object can be un-deleted.

member.name: E:Rhino.RhinoDoc.ReplaceRhinoObject
member.summary: Called if an object is about to be replaced. If either RhinoDoc::UndoActive() or RhinoDoc::RedoActive() is true, then immediatedly after ReplaceObject is called there will be a call to DeleteObject and then a call to AddObject. If both RhinoDoc::UndoActive() and RhinoDoc::RedoActive() are false, then immediatedly after ReplaceObject is called there will be a call to DeleteObject and then a call to UndeleteObject.

member.name: E:Rhino.RhinoDoc.UndeleteRhinoObject
member.summary: Called if an object is un-deleted

member.name: E:Rhino.RhinoDoc.PurgeRhinoObject
member.summary: Called if an object is begin purged from a document. The object will cease to exist forever

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ViewTable.Redraw
member.summary: Redraws all views
member.remarks: If you change something in the active document -- like adding objects, deleting objects, modifying layer or object display attributes, etc., then you need to call CRhinoDoc::Redraw to redraw all the views. If you change something in a particular view like the projection, construction plane, background bitmap, etc., then you need to call CRhinoView::Redraw to redraw that particular view.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ViewTable.Find(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find a view in this document with a main viewport that has a given name. Note that there may be multiple views in this document that have the same name. This function only returns the first view found. If you want to find all the views with a given name, use the GetViewList function and iterate through the views

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.BoundingBox
member.summary: Gets the boundingbox for all objects (normal, locked and hidden) in this document that exist in "model" space. This bounding box does not include objects that exist in layout space

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.BoundingBoxVisible
member.summary: Gets the boundingbox for all visible objects (normal and locked) in this document that exist in "model" space. This bounding box does not include hidden objects or any objects that exist in layout space

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.Find(System.Guid)
member.summary: Use the object guid to find a rhino object. Deleted objects cannot be found by id. The guid is the value that is stored on RhinoObject.Id In a single document, no two active objects have the same guid. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the guid persists. For example, if the Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits it's guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/openning operations. This function will not find grip objects.
member.param: ID of object to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.Find(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use the object runtime serial number to find a rhino object in the document. This is the value stored on RhinoObject.RuntimeObjectSerialNumber. The RhinoObject constructor sets the runtime serial number and every instance of a RhinoObject class will have a unique serial number for the duration of the Rhino application. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the new object will have a different runtime serial number. Deleted objects stored in the undo list maintain their runtime serial numbers and this funtion will return pointers to these objects. Call RhinoObject.IsDeleted if you need to determine if the returned object is active or deleted. The runtime serial number is not saved in files.
member.param: Runtime serial number to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.FindByGroup(System.Int32)
member.summary: Find all RhinoObjects that are in a given group.
member.param: Index of group to search for.
member.returns: An array of objects that belong to the specified group or null if no objects could be found.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Arc
member.summary: An Arc is a subcurve of 3d circle. The curve is parameterized by an angle expressed in radians. For an IsValid arc the total subtended angle AngleRadians() = Domain()(1) - Domain()(0) must satisfy 0 < AngleRadians() < 2*Pi The parameterization of the Arc is inherited from the Circle it is derived from. In particular t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis where xaxis and yaxis, (part of Circle.Plane) form an othonormal frame of the plane containing the circle.

member.summary: Create a new arc from a base circle and an interval of angles.
member.param: Increasing angle interval in radians with angleIntervalRadians.Length() <= 2.0*Math.PI

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Circle
member.summary: ON_Circle is a circle in 3d. The cirle is represented by a radius and an orthonormal frame of the plane containing the circle, with origin at the center. An Is_Valid() circle has positive radius and an Is_ Valid() plane defining the frame. The circle is parameterized by radians from 0 to 2 Pi given by t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis where center, xaxis and yaxis define the orthonormal frame of the circle's plane.

member.summary: Get a Brep representation of the cone with a single face for the cone, an edge along the cone seam, and vertices at the base and apex ends of this seam edge. The optional cap is a single face with one circular edge starting and ending at the base vertex.

member.summary: Replace linear segments with LineCurves.

member.summary: Replace partially circualr segments with ArcCurves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.RebuildRationals
member.summary: Replace rational nurbscurves with constant weights with an equivalent non-rational NurbsCurve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.AdjustG1

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.Merge
member.summary: Merge adjacent co-linear lines or co-circular arcs or combine consecutive line segments into a polyline.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.All
member.summary: Implies all of the simplification functions will be used.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetFilletPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Find points at which to cut a pair of curves so that a fillet of given radius can be inserted.
member.param: Parameter value for base point on curve0.
Parameter value for base point on curve1.
Parameter value of fillet point on curve 0.
Parameter value of fillet point on curve 1.
The fillet is contained in this plane with the fillet center at the plane origin.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: A fillet point is a pair of curve parameters (t0,t1) such that there is a circle of radius point3 tangent to curve c0 at t0 and tangent to curve c1 at t1. Of all possible fillet points this function returns the one which is the closest to the base point t0Base, t1Base. Distance from the base point is measured by the sum of arc lengths along the two curves.

member.returns: The fillet arc on success, or Arc.Unset on failure.

member.summary: If this curve is closed, then modify it so that the start/end point is at curve parameter t.
member.param: Curve parameter of new start/end point. The returned curves domain will start at t.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsClosable(System.Double)
member.summary: Decide if it makes sense to close off this curve by moving the endpoint to the start based on start-end gap size and length of curve as approximated by chord defined by 6 points.
member.param: Maximum allowable distance between start and end. If start - end gap is greater than tolerance, this function will return False.
member.returns: True if start and end points are close enough based on above conditions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsClosable(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Decide if it makes sense to close off this curve by moving the endpoint to the start based on start-end gap size and length of curve as approximated by chord defined by 6 points.
member.param: Maximum allowable distance between start and end. If start - end gap is greater than tolerance, this function will return False.
If greater than 0.0 and none of the interior sampled points are at least minimumAbsoluteSize from start, this function will return False.
If greater than 1.0 and chord length is less than minimumRelativeSize*gap, this function will return False.
member.returns: True if start and end points are close enough based on above conditions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.MakeClosed(System.Double)
member.summary: If IsClosed, just return True. Otherwise, decide if curve can be closed as follows: Linear curves polylinear curves with 2 segments, Nurbs with 3 or less control points cannot be made closed. Also, if tolerance > 0 and the gap between start and end is larger than tolerance, curve cannot be made closed. Adjust the curve's endpoint to match its start point.
member.param: If nonzero, and the gap is more than tolerance, curve cannot be made closed.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)

member.returns: The orientation of this curve with respect to a defined up direction.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation(Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Determine the orientation (counterclockwise or clockwise) of a closed planar curve in a given plane. Only works with simple (no self intersections) closed planar curves.
member.param: The plane in which to solve the orientation.
member.returns: The orientation of this curve in the given plane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Determine the orientation (counterclockwise or clockwise) of a closed planar curve. Only works with simple (no self intersections) closed planar curves.
member.param: Transformation to map the curve to the xy plane. If the curve is parallel to the xy plane, you may pass Identity matrix.
member.returns: The orientation of this curve in the world xy-plane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsContinuous(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double)
member.summary: Test continuity at a curve parameter value.
member.param: Type of continuity to test for.
member.returns: True if the curve has at least the c type continuity at the parameter t.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetNextDiscontinuity(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Search for a derivative, tangent, or curvature discontinuity.
member.param: Type of continuity to search for.
Search begins at t0. If there is a discontinuity at t0, it will be ignored. This makes it possible to repeatedly call GetNextDiscontinuity() and step through the discontinuities.
(t0 != t1) If there is a discontinuity at t1 it will be ignored unless continuityType is a locus discontinuity type and t1 is at the start or end of the curve.
If a discontinuity is found, then t reports the parameter at the discontinuity.
member.returns: Parametric continuity tests c = (C0_continuous, ..., G2_continuous): true if a parametric discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1. Note well that all curves are parametrically continuous at the ends of their domains. Locus continuity tests c = (C0_locus_continuous, ...,G2_locus_continuous): true if a locus discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1 or at t1 is the at the end of a curve. Note well that all open curves (IsClosed()=false) are locus discontinuous at the ends of their domains. All closed curves (IsClosed()=true) are at least C0_locus_continuous at the ends of their domains.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Simplify(Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Returns a geometrically equivalent PolyCurve.
The PolyCurve has the following properties
1. All the PolyCurve segments are LineCurve, PolylineCurve, ArcCurve, or NurbsCurve.
2. The Nurbs Curves segments do not have fully multiple interior knots.
3. Rational Nurbs curves do not have constant weights.
4. Any segment for which IsLinear() or IsArc() is true is a Line, Polyline segment, or an Arc.
5. Adjacent Colinear or Cocircular segments are combined.
6. Segments that meet with G1-continuity have there ends tuned up so that they meet with G1-continuity to within machine precision.
member.returns: New simplified curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.SimplifyEnd(Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd,Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Same as SimplifyCurve, but simplifies only the last two segments at "side" end.
member.param: If CurveEnd.Start the function simplifies the last two start side segments, otherwise if CurveEnd.End the last two end side segments are simplified.
member.returns: New simplified curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Fair(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fairs a curve object. Fair works best on degree 3 (cubic) curves. Attempts to remove large curvature variations while limiting the geometry changes to be no more than the specified tolerance.
member.param: Maximum allowed distance the faired curve is allowed to deviate from the input.
(in radians) kinks with angles <= angleTolerance are smoothed out 0.05 is a good default.

The number of (control vertices-1) to preserve at start.
0 = preserve start point
1 = preserve start point and 1st derivative
2 = preserve start point, 1st and 2nd derivative
The number of iteratoins to use in adjusting the curve.
member.returns: Returns new faired Curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Fit(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Fits a new curve through an existing curve.
member.param: The degree of the returned Curve. Must be bigger than 1.
The fitting tolerance. If fitTolerance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue or <=0.0, the document absolute tolerance is used.

The kink smoothing tolerance in radians.
If angleTolerance is 0.0, all kinks are smoothed
If angleTolerance is >0.0, kinks smaller than angleTolerance are smoothed
If angleTolerance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue or <0.0, the document angle tolerance is used for the kink smoothing
member.returns: Returns a new fitted Curve if successful, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.HasNurbsForm
member.summary: Does a NURBS curve representation of this curve exist?
member.returns: 0 unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy. 1 success - NURBS parameterization matches the curve's to the desired accuracy 2 success - NURBS point locus matches the curve's and the domain of the NURBS curve is correct. However, This curve's parameterization and the NURBS curve parameterization may not match. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of curves that have a transendental parameterization like circles

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ToPolyline(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a polyline approximation of a curve.
member.param: If mainSegmentCount <= 0, then both subSegmentCount and mainSegmentCount are ignored. If mainSegmentCount > 0, then subSegmentCount must be >= 1. In this case the nurb will be broken into mainSegmentCount equally spaced chords. If needed, each of these chords can be split into as many subSegmentCount sub-parts if the subdivision is necessary for the mesh to meet the other meshing constraints. In particular, if subSegmentCount = 0, then the curve is broken into mainSegmentCount pieces and no further testing is performed.
( 0 to pi ) Maximum angle (in radians) between unit tangents at adjacent vertices.
Maximum permitted value of (distance chord midpoint to curve) / (length of chord).

If maxAspectRatio < 1.0, the parameter is ignored. If 1 <= maxAspectRatio < sqrt(2), it is treated as if maxAspectRatio = sqrt(2). This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of (length of longest chord) / (length of shortest chord).
If tolerance = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of the distance from the curve to the polyline.
If maxEdgeLength = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted edge length.
If true the starting point of the curve is added to the polyline. If false the starting point of the curve is not added to the polyline.
member.returns: PolylineCurve on success, null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ToPolyline(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Get a polyline approximation of a curve.
member.param: If mainSegmentCount <= 0, then both subSegmentCount and mainSegmentCount are ignored. If mainSegmentCount > 0, then subSegmentCount must be >= 1. In this case the nurb will be broken into mainSegmentCount equally spaced chords. If needed, each of these chords can be split into as many subSegmentCount sub-parts if the subdivision is necessary for the mesh to meet the other meshing constraints. In particular, if subSegmentCount = 0, then the curve is broken into mainSegmentCount pieces and no further testing is performed.
( 0 to pi ) Maximum angle (in radians) between unit tangents at adjacent vertices.
Maximum permitted value of (distance chord midpoint to curve) / (length of chord).

If maxAspectRatio < 1.0, the parameter is ignored. If 1 <= maxAspectRatio < sqrt(2), it is treated as if maxAspectRatio = sqrt(2). This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of (length of longest chord) / (length of shortest chord).
If tolerance = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of the distance from the curve to the polyline.
If maxEdgeLength = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted edge length.
If true the starting point of the curve is added to the polyline. If false the starting point of the curve is not added to the polyline.
This subdomain of the NURBS curve is approximated.
member.returns: PolylineCurve on success, null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.PullToMesh(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh,System.Double)
member.summary: Makes a polyline approximation of the curve and gets the closest point on the mesh for each point on the curve. Then it "connects the points" so that you have a polyline on the mesh.
member.param: Input tolerance (RhinoDoc.ModelAbsoluteTolerance is a good default)
member.returns: A polyline curve on success, null on failure.

The positive or negative distance to offset.
member.returns: Offset curves on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Boundingbox solver. Gets the world axis aligned boundingbox for the geometry.
member.param: If True, a physically accurate boundingbox will be computed. If not, a boundingbox estimate will be computed. For some geometry types there is no difference between the estimate and the accurate boundingbox. Estimated boundingboxes can be computed much (much) faster than accurate (or "tight") bounding boxes. Estimated bounding boxes are always similar to or larger than accurate bounding boxes.
member.returns: The boundingbox of the geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Aligned Boundingbox solver. Gets the world axis aligned boundingbox for the transformed geometry.
member.param: Transformation to apply to object prior to the BoundingBox computation. The geometry itself is not modified.
member.returns: The accurate boundingbox of the transformed geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.param: If true, create a periodic uniform curve. If false, create a clamped uniform curve
