member.summary: Increase the degree of this curve.
member.param: The desired degree. Degrees should be number between and including 1 and 11.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.MakePiecewiseBezier(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clamps ends and adds knots so the NURBS curve has bezier spans (all distinct knots have multiplitity = degree).
member.param: If true and the first or last weight is not one, then the first and last spans are reparameterized so that the end weights are one.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.Reparameterize(System.Double)
member.summary: Use a linear fractional transformation to reparameterize the NURBS curve. This does not change the curve's domain.
member.param: reparameterization constant (generally speaking, c should be > 0). The control points and knots are adjusted so that output_nurbs(t) = input_nurbs(lambda(t)), where lambda(t) = c*t/( (c-1)*t + 1 ). Note that lambda(0) = 0, lambda(1) = 1, lambda'(t) > 0, lambda'(0) = c and lambda'(1) = 1/c.
member.returns: true if successful
member.remarks: The cv and knot values are values are changed so that output_nurbs(t) = input_nurbs(lambda(t)).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.ChangeEndWeights(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Use a combination of scaling and reparameterization to change the end weights to the specified values.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: The domain, euclidean locations of the control points, and locus of the curve do not change, but the weights, homogeneous cv values and internal knot values may change. If w0 and w1 are 1 and the curve is not rational, the curve is not changed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.MakeRational

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.NurbsCurvePointList.MakeNonRational
member.summary: Sets all the control points to 1.0

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsValid
member.summary: returns true if a, b, c, and d are valid finite IEEE doubles.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Conjugate
member.summary: Returns the conjugate of the quaternion = (a,-b,-c,-d)

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Inverse
member.summary: Sets the quaternion to a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2, where L2 = length squared = (a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d). This is the multiplicative inverse, i.e., (a,b,c,d)*(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2) = (1,0,0,0). If "this" is the zero quaternion, then the zero quaternion is returned.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.LengthSquared
member.summary: Returns a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Vector
member.summary: The "vector" or "imaginary" part of the quaternion = (b,c,d)

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Scalar
member.summary: The "real" or "scalar" part of the quaternion = a.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsZero
member.summary: True if a, b, c, and d are all zero.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsScalar
member.summary: True if b, c, and d are all zero.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsVector
member.summary: True if a = 0 and at least one of b, c, or d is not zero.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Invert
member.summary: Sets the quaternion to a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2, where L2 = length squared = (a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d). This is the multiplicative inverse, i.e., (a,b,c,d)*(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2) = (1,0,0,0).
member.returns: True if successful. False if the quaternion is zero and cannot be inverted.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.MatrixForm
member.summary: Returns 4x4 real valued matrix form of the quaternion a b c d -b a -d c -c d a -b -d -c b a which has the same arithmetic properties in as the quaternion.
member.remarks: Do not confuse this with the rotation defined by the quaternion. This function will only be interesting to math nerds and is not useful in rendering or animation applications.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.SetRotation(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Sets the quaternion to cos(angle/2), sin(angle/2)*x, sin(angle/2)*y, sin(angle/2)*z where (x,y,z) is the unit vector parallel to axis. This is the unit quaternion that represents the rotation of angle about axis.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Rotation(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Returns the unit quaternion cos(angle/2), sin(angle/2)*x, sin(angle/2)*y, sin(angle/2)*z where (x,y,z) is the unit vector parallel to axis. This is the unit quaternion that represents the rotation of angle about axis.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Product(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary: The quaternion product of p and q. This is the same value as p*q.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.CrossProduct(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary: The vector cross product of p and q = (0,x,y,z) where (x,y,z) = ON_CrossProduct(p.Vector(),q.Vector()) This is NOT the same as the quaternion product p*q.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.op_Multiply(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary: quaternion multiplication is not commutative

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.Mirror(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Create mirror transformation matrix The mirror transform maps a point Q to Q - (2*(Q-P)oN)*N, where P = pointOnMirrorPlane and N = normalToMirrorPlane.
member.param: Normal vector to the mirror plane.
member.returns: A transformation matrix which mirrors geometry in a specified plane.

member.param: Coordinate system in which the geometry is currently described.
Target coordinate system in which we want the geometry to be described.

member.summary: Similarity is preserved, but orientation is flipped.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.TransformSimilarityType.NotSimilarity
member.summary: Similarity is not preserved. Geometry needs to be deformable for this Transform to operate correctly.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.TransformSimilarityType.OrientationPreserving
member.summary: Similarity and orientation are preserved.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.Tolerance
member.summary: The desired accuracy of the morph. This value is primarily used for deforming surfaces and breps. The default is 0.0 and any value <= 0.0 is ignored by morphing functions. The Tolerance value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.QuickPreview
member.summary: True if the morph should be done as quickly as possible because the result is being used for some type of dynamic preview. If QuickPreview is true, the tolerance may be ignored. The QuickPreview value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.PreserveStructure
member.summary: True if the morph should be done in a way that preserves the structure of the geometry. In particular, for NURBS objects, true means that only the control points are moved. The PreserveStructure value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.Morph(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase)
member.summary: Apply the space morph to geometry
member.returns: true on success, false on failure

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.IsMorphable(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase)
member.summary: True if the geometry can be morphed by calling SpaceMorph.Morph(geometry)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.MorphPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Morphs euclidean point
member.returns: morphed point

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType
member.summary: The possible relationships between the instance definition geometry and the archive containing the original defition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Static
member.summary: This instance definition is never updated. If m_source_archive is set, it records the origin of the instance definition geometry, but m_source_archive is never used to update the instance definition

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Embedded
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the user is asked if they want to update the instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.LinkedAndEmbedded
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the instance definition is automatically updated. If m_source_archive is not available, the instance definition is still valid.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is not embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the instance definition is automatically updated. If m_source_archive is not available, the instance definition is not valid. This does not save runtime memory. It may save a little disk space, but it is a foolish option requested by people who do not understand all the issues.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceObject.InstanceXform

member.summary: Determine if this instance definition contains a reference to another instance definition.
member.returns: 0 no 1 other_idef_index is the index of this instance definition >1 This InstanceDefinition uses the instance definition and the returned value is the nesting depth.

member.summary: At all times, there is a "current" linetype. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current linetype. If the current linetype source is LinetypeFromLayer the object's layer's linetype is used instead

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.LinetypeScale
member.summary: For display in Rhino viewports, the linetypes are scaled by a single scale factor for all viewports. This is not used for printing, where all linetype patterns are scaled to print in their defined size 1:1 on the paper.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.CurrentLinetypeSource
member.summary: Source used by an object to determine its current linetype to be used by new objects.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.CurrentLinetype
member.summary: At all times, there is a "current" linetype. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current linetype. The current linetype is never deleted. Returns reference to the current linetype. Note that this reference may become invalid after a call to AddLinetype().

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.ContinuousLinetypeName
member.summary: Returns the text name of the continuous linetype

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.ByLayerLinetypeName
member.summary: Returns the text name of the bylayer linetype

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.SetCurrentLinetypeIndex(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: At all times, there is a "current" linetype. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current linetype. The current linetype is never deleted.
member.param: Value for new current linetype. 0 <= linetypeIndex < LinetypeTable.Count.
if true, then no warning message box pops up if the current linetype request can't be satisfied.
member.returns: true if current linetype index successfully set.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.LinetypeIndexForObject(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary: Returns the effective linetype index to be used to find the linetype definition to draw an object. If an object's linetype source is LinetypeFromObject, the linetype index in the object's attributes is used. If an object's linetype source is LinetypeFromLayer the linetype index from the object's layer is used.

member.summary: Find a linetype with a matching id

member.summary: Adds a new linetype with specified definition to the linetype table.

zero based index of linetype to set
if true, information message boxes pop up when illegal changes are attempted.

member.name: T:Rhino.UI.MouseCallback
member.summary: Used for intercepting mouse events in the Rhino viewports

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Mode
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.IsInstanceDefinitionObject
member.summary: Use this query to determine if an object is part of an instance definition.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Visible
member.summary: object visibility

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LinetypeSource
member.summary: The Linetype used to display an object is specified in one of two ways. If LinetypeSource is ON::linetype_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::Linetype() is used. If LinetypeSource is ON::linetype_from_object, then value of m_linetype is used.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ColorSource
member.summary: The color used to display an object is specified in one of three ways. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::Color() is used. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_object, then value of m_color is used. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_material, then the diffuse color of the object's render material is used. See ON_3dmObjectAttributes::MaterialSource() to determine where to get the definition of the object's render material.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotColorSource
member.summary: The color used to plot an object on paper is specified in one of three ways. If PlotColorSource is ON::plot_color_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::PlotColor() is used. If PlotColorSource is ON::plot_color_from_object, then value of PlotColor() is used.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.DisplayMode
member.summary: objects can be displayed in one of three ways: wireframe, shaded, or render preview. If the display mode is ON::default_display, then the display mode of the viewport detrmines how the object is displayed. If the display mode is ON::wireframe_display, ON::shaded_display, or ON::renderpreview_display, then the object is forced to display in that mode.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectId
member.summary: Every object has a UUID (universally unique identifier). The default value is Guid.Empty. When an object is added to a model, the value is checked. If the value is NULL, a new UUID is created. If the value is not NULL but it is already used by another object in the model, a new UUID is created. If the value is not NULL and it is not used by another object in the model, then that value persists. When an object is updated, by a move for example, the value of ObjectId persists.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Name
member.summary: objects have optional text names. More than one object in a model can have the same name and some objects may have no name.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LayerIndex
member.summary: Layer definitions in an OpenNURBS model are stored in a layer table. The layer table is conceptually an array of ON_Layer classes. Every OpenNURBS object in a model is on some layer. The object's layer is specified by zero based indicies into the ON_Layer array.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LinetypeIndex
member.summary: Linetype definitions in an OpenNURBS model are stored in a linetype table. The linetype table is conceptually an array of ON_Linetype classes. Every OpenNURBS object in a model references some linetype. The object's linetype is specified by zero based indicies into the ON_Linetype array. index 0 is reserved for continuous linetype (no pattern)

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.MaterialIndex
member.summary: If you want something simple and fast, set m_material_index to the index of the rendering material and ignore m_rendering_attributes. If you are developing a high quality plug-in renderer, and a user is assigning one of your fabulous rendering materials to this object, then add rendering material information to the m_rendering_attributes.m_materials[] array.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.MaterialSource
member.summary: Determine if the simple material should come from the object or from it's layer. High quality rendering plug-ins should use m_rendering_attributes.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectColor
member.summary: If ON::color_from_object == ColorSource, then color is the object's display color.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotColor
member.summary: If plot_color_from_object == PlotColorSource, then PlotColor is the object's plotting color.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotWeight
member.summary: Plot weight in millimeters. =0.0 means use the default width <0.0 means don't plot (visible for screen display, but does not show on plot)

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectDecoration
member.summary: Used to indicate an object has a decoration (like an arrowhead on a curve)

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.WireDensity
member.summary: When a surface object is displayed in wireframe, m_wire_density controls how many isoparametric wires are used. value number of isoparametric wires 0 boundary and knot wires 1 boundary and knot wires and, if there are no interior knots, a single interior wire. N>=2 boundary and knot wires and (N+1) interior wires

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ViewportId
member.summary: If ViewportId is nil, the object is active in all viewports. If ViewportId is not nil, then this object is only active in a specific view. This field is primarily used to assign page space objects to a specific page, but it can also be used to restrict model space to a specific view.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Space
member.summary: Starting with V4, objects can be in either model space or page space. If an object is in page space, then ViewportId is not nil and identifies the page it is on.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.GroupCount
member.summary: number of groups object belongs to

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Duplicate
member.summary: Create a copy of this ObjectAttributes

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.GetGroupList
member.summary: Returns an array of GroupCount group indices. If GroupCount is zero, then GetGroupList() returns null.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.AddToGroup(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds object to the group with specified index by appending index to group list (If the object is already in group, nothing is changed.)

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.RemoveFromGroup(System.Int32)
member.summary: removes object from the group with specified index. If the object is not in the group, nothing is changed.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.RemoveFromAllGroups
member.summary: Removes object from all groups

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.ShouldCallWriteDocument(Rhino.FileIO.FileWriteOptions)
member.summary: Called whenever a Rhino is about to save a .3dm file. If you want to save plug-in document data when a model is saved in a version 5 .3dm file, then you must override this function to return true and you must override WriteDocument().
member.returns: True if the plug-in wants to save document user data in the version 5 .3dm file. The default returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.WriteDocument(Rhino.RhinoDoc,Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter,Rhino.FileIO.FileWriteOptions)
member.summary: Called when Rhino is saving a .3dm file to allow the plug-in to save document user data.
member.param: OpenNURBS file archive object Rhino is using to write the file. Use BinaryArchiveWriter.Write*() functions to write plug-in data. OR use the ArchivableDictionary If any BinaryArchiveWriter.Write*() functions throw an exception, then archive.WriteErrorOccured will be true and you should immediately return. Setting archive.WriteErrorOccured to true will cause Rhino to stop saving the file.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.ReadDocument(Rhino.RhinoDoc,Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader,Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions)
member.summary: Called whenever a Rhino document is being loaded and plug-in user data was encountered written by a plug-in with this plug-in's GUID.
member.param: OpenNURBS file archive object Rhino is using to read this file. Use BinaryArchiveReader.Read*() functions to read plug-in data. If any BinaryArchive.Read*() functions throws an exception then archive.ReadErrorOccurve will be true and you should immediately return.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.LicenseUtils.GetLicense(System.Guid,System.String,Rhino.PlugIns.ValidateProductKeyDelegate)
member.summary: Verifies that the valid product license is available for use. If the product is installed as a standalone node, the local license will be validated. If the product is installed as a network node, a loaner license will be requested by the system's assigned Zoo server.
member.param: The Guid of the product whose license you want to verify or request from a Zoo server.
A localized product title, such as "Rhinoceros 5.0", that can be used in license request forms or message boxes, if needed.
Since the license client knows nothing about your product license, you will need to valiate your product license by supplying a callback function, or delegate, that can be called for valiation.
member.returns: True if the license was obtained and validated successful. False if not successful or on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.LicenseUtils.ReturnLicense(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a loaned out license to the Zoo server from which it was borrowed.
member.param: The Guid of the product that you want to return.
member.returns: True if the license was returned successful. False if not successful or on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.LicenseUtils.CheckOutLicense(System.Guid)
member.summary: Checks out a license that is on loan from a Zoo server on a permanent basis.
member.param: The Guid of the product that you want to check out.
member.returns: True if the license was checked out successful. False if not successful or on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.LicenseUtils.CheckInLicense(System.Guid)
member.summary: Checks in a previously checked out license to the Zoo server from which it was checked out.
member.param: The Guid of the product that you want to check in.
member.returns: True if the license was checked in successful. False if not successful or on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.LicenseUtils.ConvertLicense(System.Guid)
member.summary: Converts a product license from a standalone node to a network node.
member.param: The Guid of the product that you want to check in.
member.returns: True if the license was successfully converted. False if not successful or on error.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsNormal
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsLocked
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsHidden
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsReference

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Id
member.summary: Every object has a UUID (universally unique identifier). The default value is Guid.Empty. When an object is added to a model, the value is checked. If the value is Guid.Empty, a new UUID is created. If the value is not NULL but it is already used by another object in the model, a new UUID is created. If the value is not Guid.Empty and it is not used by another object in the model, then that value persists. When an object is updated, by a move for example, the value of ObjectId persists.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Name
member.summary: Rhino objects have optional text names. More than one object in a model can have the same name and some objects may have no name.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSelected(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check selection state
member.param: (false is good default) If true and the entire object is not selected, and some subset of the object is selected, like some edges of a surface, then 3 is returned. If false and the entire object is not selected, then zero is returned.
member.returns: 0 = object is not selected. 1 = object is selected. 2 = entire object is selected persistently. 3 = one or more proper sub-objects are selected.

member.remarks: subobject cannot be persistently selected

member.summary: Get a list of all selected sub-objects

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSelectable(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reports if an object can be selected
member.param: If true, then selected objects are selectable. If false, then selected objects are not selectable.
If true, then objects with grips on can be selected. If false, then the value returned by the object's IsSelectableWithGripsOn() function decides if the object can be selected.
If true, then objects on locked layers are selectable. If false, then objects on locked layers are not selectable.
If true, then objects on hidden layers are selectable. If false, then objects on hidden layers are not selectable.
member.returns: true if object is capable of being selected
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSelectable
member.summary: Reports if an object can be selected
member.returns: true if object is capable of being selected
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSubObjectSelectable(Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reports if a subobject can be selected
member.param: If true, then selected objects are selectable. If false, then selected objects are not selectable.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Select(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reports if an object can be selected
member.param: If true, then the object is hightlighted if it is selected and not hightlighted if is is not selected.
Objects that are persistently selected stay selected when a command terminates.

If true, then objects with grips on can be selected. If false, then the value returned by the object's IsSelectableWithGripsOn() function decides if the object can be selected when it has grips turned on.
If true, then objects on locked layers can be selected. If false, then objects on locked layers cannot be selected.
If true, then objects on hidden layers can be selectable. If false, then objects on hidden layers cannot be selected.
member.returns: 0: object is not selected 1: object is selected 2: object is selected persistently
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.ObjectId
member.summary: Returns the id of the referenced Rhino object.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.RuntimeSerialNumber
member.summary: If > 0, then this is the value of a Rhino object's serial number field. The serial number is used instead of the pointer to prevent crashes in cases when the RhinoObject is deleted but an ObjRef continues to reference the Rhino object. The value of RuntimeSerialNumber is not saved in archives because it generally changes if you save and reload an archive.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.Object
member.summary: Returns the referenced Rhino object.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SelectionMethod
member.summary: Get the method used to select this object.
member.returns: The method used to select this object.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SelectionPoint
member.summary: If the object was selected by picking a point on it, then SelectionPoint() returns the point where the selection occured, otherwise it returns Point3d.Unset.
member.returns: The point where the selection occured or Point3d.Unset on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.CurveParameter(System.Double@)
member.summary: If the reference geometry is a curve or edge with a selection point, then this gets the parameter of the selection point.
member.param: The parameter of the selection point.
member.returns: If the selection point was on a curve or edge, then the curve/edge is returned, otherwise null.
member.remarks: If a curve was selected and CurveParameter is called and the SelectionMethod() is not 1 (point pick on object), the curve will be returned and parameter will be set to the start parameter of the picked curve. This can be misleading so it may be necessary to call SelectionMethod() first, before calling CurveParameter to get the desired information.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SurfaceParameter(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: If the reference geometry is a surface, brep with one face, or surface edge with a selection point, then this gets the surface paramters of the selection point.
member.returns: If the selection point was on a surface, the the surface is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Interval.FromIntersection(Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: If the intersection is not empty, then intersection = [max(a.Min(),b.Min()), min(a.Max(),b.Max())] The interval [ON.UnsetValue,ON.UnsetValue] is considered to be the empty set interval. The result of any intersection involving an empty set interval or disjoint intervals is the empty set interval.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Interval.FromUnion(Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: The union of an empty set and an increasing interval is the increasing interval. The union of two empty sets is empty. The union of an empty set an a non-empty interval is the non-empty interval. The union of two non-empty intervals is union = [min(a.Min(),b.Min()), max(a.Max(),b.Max()),] Union() returns true if the union is not empty.

member.name: T:Rhino.RhinoApp
member.summary: .NET RhinoApp is parallel to C++ CRhinoApp

member.name: P:Rhino.RhinoApp.SdkVersion
member.summary: Rhino SDK 9 digit SDK version number in the form YYYYMMDDn Rhino will only load plug-ins that were build with exactly the same version of the SDK.

member.name: P:Rhino.RhinoApp.SdkServiceRelease
member.summary: Rhino SDK 9 digit SDK service release number in the form YYYYMMDDn Service service release of the Rhino SDK supported by this executable. Rhino will only load plug-ins that require a service release of <= this release number. For example, SR1 will load all plug-ins made with any SDK released up through and including the SR1 SDK. But, SR1 will not load a plug-in built using the SR2 SDK. If an "old" Rhino tries to load a "new" plug-in, the user is told that they have to get a free Rhino.exe update in order for the plug-in to load. Rhino.exe updates are available from http://www.rhino3d.com.

member.name: P:Rhino.RhinoApp.ExeVersion

member.name: P:Rhino.RhinoApp.ExeServiceRelease
member.summary: Service release version of Rhino executable (0, 1, 2, ...) The integer is the service release number of Rhino. For example, this function returns "0" if Rhino V4SR0 is running and returns "1" if Rhino V4SR1 is running.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.Exit
member.summary: Exits, or closes, Rhino.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.RunScript(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Run a Rhino command script.
member.param: Controls how the script is echoed in the command output window. false = silent - nothing is echoed true = verbatim - the script is echoed literally
member.remarks: Rhino acts as if each character in the script string had been typed in the command prompt. When RunScript is called from a "script runner" command, it completely runs the script before returning. When RunScript is called outside of a command, it returns and the script is run. This way menus and buttons can use RunScript to execute complicated functions.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.GetPlugInObject(System.Guid)
member.summary: Get the object that is returned by PlugIn.GetPlugInObject for a given plug-in. This function attempts to find and load a plug-in with a given Id. When a plug-in is found, it's GetPlugInObject function is called and the result is returned here. Note the plug-in must have already been installed in Rhino or the plug-in manager will not know where to look for a plug-in with a matching id.
member.returns: Result of PlugIn.GetPlugInObject for a given plug-in on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.GetPlugInObject(System.String)
member.summary: Get the object that is returned by PlugIn.GetPlugInObject for a given plug-in. This function attempts to find and load a plug-in with a given name. When a plug-in is found, it's GetPlugInObject function is called and the result is returned here. Note the plug-in must have already been installed in Rhino or the plug-in manager will not know where to look for a plug-in with a matching name.
member.returns: Result of PlugIn.GetPlugInObject for a given plug-in on success.

member.summary: Light Year http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Light_year 9.46073e+15 meters http://units.nist.gov/Pubs/SP811/appenB9.htm A light year is the distance light travels in one Julian year. member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C0_continuous
member.summary: Continuous Function : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C1_continuous
member.summary: Continuous first derivative : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C2_continuous
member.summary: Continuous first derivative and second derivative : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G1_continuous
member.summary: Continuous unit tangent : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G2_continuous
member.summary: Continuous unit tangent and curvature : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C0_locus_continuous
member.summary: locus continuous function : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C1_locus_continuous
member.summary: locus continuous first derivative : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject
member.summary: The GetObject class is the tool commands use to interactively select objects.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.GeometryFilter
member.summary: The geometry type filter controls which types of geometry (points, curves, surfaces, meshes, etc.) can be selected. The default geometry type filter permits selection of all types of geometry. NOTE: the filter can be a bitwise combination of multiple ObjectTypes

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.GeometryAttributeFilter
member.summary: The geometry attribute filter provides a secondary filter that can be used to restrict which objects can be selected. Control of the type of geometry (points, curves, surfaces, meshes, etc.) is provided by GetObject.SetGeometryFilter. The geometry attribute filter is used to require the selected geometry to have certain attributes (open, closed, etc.). The default attribute filter permits selection of all types of geometry.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.DeselectAllBeforePostSelect
member.summary: True if pre-selected input will be deselected before post-selection begins when no pre-selected input is valid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.OneByOnePostSelect
member.summary: In one-by-one post selection, the user is forced to select objects by post picking them one at a time.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.SubObjectSelect
member.summary: By default, GetObject.Input will permit a user to select sub-objects (like a curve in a b-rep or a curve in a group). If you only want the user to select "top" level objects, then call EnableSubObjectSelect = false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.ChooseOneQuestion
member.summary: By default, if a call to Input is permitted to select different parts of the same object, like a polysurface and an edge of that polysurface, then the top-most object is automatically selected. If you want the choose-one-object mechanism to include pop up in these cases, then call EnableChooseOneQuestion = true before calling GetObjects().

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.BottomObjectPreference
member.summary: By default, if a call to Input is permitted to select different parts of the same object, like a polysurface, a surface and an edge, then the top-most object is prefered. (polysurface beats face beats edge). If you want the bottom most object to be prefered, then call EnableBottomObjectPreference = true before calling GetObjects().

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.GroupSelect
member.summary: By default, groups are ignored in GetObject. If you want your call to GetObjects() to select every object in a group that has any objects selected, then enable group selection.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.ReferenceObjectSelect
member.summary: By default, reference objects can be selected. If you do not want to be able to select reference objects, then call EnableReferenceObjectSelect=false

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.AlreadySelectedObjectSelect
member.summary: Allow selecting objects that are already selected. By default, GetObjects() disallows selection of objects that are already selected to avoid putting the same object in the selection set more than once. Calling EnableAlreadySelectedObjectSelect = true overrides that restriction and allows selected objects to be selected and returned by GetObjects. This is useful because, coupled with the return immediately mode of GetObjects( 1, -1), it is possible to select a selected object to deselect when the selected objects are being managed outside GetObjects() as in the case of CRhinoPolyEdge::GetEdge().

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.ObjectCount
member.summary: Gets the number of objects that were selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.SerialNumber
member.summary: Each instance of GetObject has a unique runtime serial number that is used to identify object selection events associated with that instance.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.CustomGeometryFilter(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject,Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase,Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex)
member.summary: Checks geometry to see if it can be selected. Override to provide fancy filtering.
member.param: if >= 0, geometry is a proper sub-part of object->Geometry() with componentIndex
member.returns: The default always returns true

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.PassesGeometryAttributeFilter(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject,Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase,Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex)
member.summary: Checks geometry to see if it passes the basic GeometryAttributeFilter.
member.param: if >= 0, geometry is a proper sub-part of object->Geometry() with componentIndex.
member.returns: true if the geometry passes the filter returned by GeometryAttributeFilter().

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnablePreSelect(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the pre selection behavior GetObjects.
member.param: If true and some acceptable objects are pre-selected, then any unacceptable pre-selected objects are ignored. If false and any unacceptable are pre-selected, then the user is forced to post-select.
member.remarks: By default, if valid input is pre-selected when GetObjects() is called, then that input is returned and the user is not given the opportunity to post-select. If you want to force the user to post-select, then call EnablePreSelect(false).

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnablePostSelect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of post selection in GetObjects.
member.remarks: By default, if no valid input is pre-selected when GetObjects is called, then the user is given the chance to post select. If you want to force the user to pre-select, then call EnablePostSelect(false).

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableSelPrevious(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, any object selected during a command becomes part of the "previous selection set" and can be reselected by the SelPrev command. If you need to select objects but do not want them to be selected by a subsquent call to SelPrev, then call EnableSelPrev = false

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableHighlight(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, any object post-pick selected by GetObjects() is highlighted. If you want to post-pick objects and not have them automatically highlight, then call EnableHighlight = false

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableIgnoreGrips(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, post selection will select objects with grips on. If you do not want to be able to post select objects with grips on, then call EnableIgnoreGrips = false. The ability to preselect an object with grips on is determined by the value returned by the virtual RhinoObject.IsSelectableWithGripsOn.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnablePressEnterWhenDonePrompt(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, when GetObject.GetObjects is called with minimumNumber > 0 and maximumNumber = 0, the command prompt automatically includes "Press Enter when done" after the user has selected at least minimumNumber of objects. If you want to prohibit the addition of the "Press Enter when done", then call EnablePressEnterWhenDonePrompt = false;

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.SetPressEnterWhenDonePrompt(System.String)
member.summary: The default prompt when EnablePressEnterWhenDonePrompt is enabled is "Press Enter when done". Use this function to specify a different string to be appended.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.Get
member.summary: Call to select a single object
member.returns: Success - objects selected. Cancel - user pressed ESCAPE to cancel the get. See GetResults for other possible values that may be returned when options, numbers, etc., are acceptable responses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.GetMultiple(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Call to select objects.
member.param: minimum number of objects to select.

maximum number of objects to select. If 0, then the user must press enter to finish object selection. If -1, then object selection stops as soon as there are at least minimumNumber of object selected. If >0, then the picking stops when there are maximumNumber objects. If a window pick, crossing pick, or Sel* command attempts to add more than maximumNumber, then the attempt is ignored.
member.returns: Success - objects selected. Cancel - user pressed ESCAPE to cancel the get. See GetResults for other possible values that may be returned when options, numbers, etc., are acceptable responses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableClearObjectsOnEntry(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default the picked object list is cleared when GetObject.GetObjects() is called. If you are reusing a GetObject class and do not want the existing object list cleared when you call Input, then call EnableClearObjectsOnEntry(false) before calling GetObjects().

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableUnselectObjectsOnExit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default any objects in the object list are unselected when GetObject.GetObjects() exits with any return code besides Object. If you want to leave the objects selected when non-object input is returned, then call EnableClearObjectsOnExit(false) before calling GetObjects().

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter
member.summary: If an object passes the geometry TYPE filter, then the geometry ATTRIBUTE filter is applied.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.WireCurve
member.summary: 3d wire curve If you want to accept only wire or edge curves, then specify wire_curve or edge_curve, otherwise both wire and edge curves will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.EdgeCurve
member.summary: 3d curve of a surface edge If you want to accept only wire or edge curves, then specify wire_curve or edge_curve, otherwise both wire and edge curves will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ClosedCurve
member.summary: Closed Curves and Edges are acceptable If you want to accept only closed or open curves, then specify either closed_curve or open_curve. Otherwise both closed and open curves will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OpenCurve
member.summary: Open Curves and Edges are acceptable If you want to accept only closed or open curves, then specify either closed_curve or open_curve. Otherwise both closed and open curves will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.SeamEdge
member.summary: seam edges are acceptable attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim). If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ManifoldEdge
member.summary: edges with 2 different surfaces pass attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim). If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.NonmanifoldEdge
member.summary: edges with 3 or more surfaces pass attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim). If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.MatedEdge
member.summary: any mated edge passes attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim). If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.SurfaceBoundaryEdge
member.summary: boundary edges on surface sides pass attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim). If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.TrimmingBoundaryEdge
member.summary: boundary edges that trim a surface pass attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim). If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.BoundaryEdge
member.summary: ant boundary edge passes attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim). If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ClosedSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open surfaces, then specify either closed_surface or open_surface. Otherwise both closed and open surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OpenSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open surfaces, then specify either closed_surface or open_surface. Otherwise both closed and open surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.TrimmedSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only trimmed or untrimmed surfaces, then specify either trimmed_surface or untrimmed_surface. Otherwise both trimmed and untrimmed surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.UntrimmedSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only trimmed or untrimmed surfaces, then specify either trimmed_surface or untrimmed_surface. Otherwise both trimmed and untrimmed surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.SubSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only sub-surfaces of (multi-surface) polysrf, then specify sub_surface. If you do not want to accept sub-surfaces, then specify top_surface. Otherwise sub-surfaces and top surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.TopSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only sub-surfaces of (multi-surface) polysrf, then specify sub_surface. If you do not want to accept sub-surfaces, then specify top_surface. Otherwise sub-surfaces and top surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ManifoldPolysrf
member.summary: If you want to accept only manifold or nonmanifold polysrfs, then specify manifold_polysrf or nonmanifold_polysrf. Otherwise both manifold and nonmanifold polysrfs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.NonmanifoldPolysrf
member.summary: If you want to accept only manifold or nonmanifold polysrfs, then specify manifold_polysrf or nonmanifold_polysrf. Otherwise both manifold and nonmanifold polysrfs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ClosedPolysrf
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open polysrfs, then specify either closed_polysrf or open_polysrf. Otherwise both closed and open polysrfs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OpenPolysrf
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open polysrfs, then specify either closed_polysrf or open_polysrf. Otherwise both closed and open polysrfs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ClosedMesh
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open meshs, then specify either closed_mesh or open_mesh. Otherwise both closed and open meshs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OpenMesh
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open meshs, then specify either closed_mesh or open_mesh. Otherwise both closed and open meshs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.BoundaryInnerLoop
member.summary: all trimming edges are boundary edges

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.MatedInnerLoop
member.summary: all trimming edges are mated

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.InnerLoop
member.summary: any inner loop is acceptable

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.BoundaryOuterLoop
member.summary: all trimming edges are boundary edges

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.MatedOuterLoop
member.summary: all trimming edges are mated

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OuterLoop
member.summary: any outer loop is acceptable

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.SpecialLoop
member.summary: slit, crvonsrf, ptonsrf, etc.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new GetPoint

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.MouseMove
member.summary: Called every time the mouse moves. MouseMove is called once per mouse move and is called BEFORE any calls to OnDynamicDraw. If you are doing anything that takes a long time, periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should stop. If the view is such that the 2d screen point can't be mapped to a 3d point, the 'point' argument will be Unset

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.MouseDown
member.summary: Called during Get2dRectangle, Get2dLine, and GetPoint(..,true) when the mouse down event for the initial point occurs. This function is not called during ordinary point getting because the mouse down event terminates an ordinary point get and returns a GetResult.Point result.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DynamicDraw
member.summary: Event to use if you want to dynamically draw things as the mouse/digitizer moves. Every time the mouse moves, DynamicDraw will be called once per viewport. The calls to DynamicDraw happen AFTER the call to MouseMove. If you are drawing anything that takes a long time, periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should stop.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DynamicDrawColor
member.summary: Color used by CRhinoGetPoint::DynamicDraw to draw the current point and the line from the base point to the current point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.SetBasePoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set base point used by ortho snap, from snap, planar snap, etc.
member.param: if true, then the distance from base_point to the current point will be in the status bar distance pane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainDistanceFromBasePoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Set distance constraint from base point
member.param: pass UnsetValue to clear this constraint. Pass 0.0 to disable the ability to set this constraint by typing a number during GetPoint.
member.remarks: If the base point is set and the distance from base point constraint is > 0, then the picked point is constrained to be this distance from the base point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DrawLineFromPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use DrawLineFromPoint() if you want a dynamic line drawn from a point to the point being picked.
member.param: The line is drawn from startPoint to the point being picked. If the base point has not been set, then it is set to startPoint.
if true, the distance from the basePoint to the point begin picked is shown in the status bar.
member.remarks: Calling DrawLineFromPoint automatically enables drawing the line. Use EnableDrawLineFromPoint() to toggle the line drawing state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableDrawLineFromPoint(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls drawing of dynamic a line from the start point
member.param: if true, a dynamic line is drawn from the DrawLineFromPoint startPoint to the point being picked.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitOrthoSnap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls availability of ortho snap. Default is true.
member.param: if true, then GetPoint pays attention to the Rhino "ortho snap" and "planar snap" settings reported by ModelAidSettings.Ortho and ModelAidSettings.Planar

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitFromOption(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of the built-in "From" option. By default, the "From" option is enabled.
member.param: if true, then the "From" option is automatically avaiable in GetPoint.
member.remarks: The GetPoint "From" option is never visible on the command line and the user must type the complete option name to activate the "From" option. When the GetPoint "From" snap is enabled, the user set/change the base point during GetPoint by typing "From" and picking a point. A related option is the builit-in distance from base point constraint that is can be set before GetPoint is called by passing a value to GetPoint::ConstrainDistanceFromBasePoint or during GetPoint by entering a number.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitConstraintOptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of the built-in linear, planar, curve, and surface constraint options like "Along", "AlongPerp", "AlongTan", "AlongParallel", "Between", "OnCrv", "OnSrf", ".x", ".y", ".z", ".xy", etc.
member.param: if true, then the built-in contraint options are automatically avaiable in GetPoint.
member.remarks: By default, these built-in constraint options are availble unless an explicit constraint is added by calling one of the GetPoint::Constrain functions. Calling GetPoint::ClearConstraints automatically enables the built-in constraint options. The built-in constraint options are never visible on the command line and the user must type the complete option name to activate these options.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitTabMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Permit use of the tab key to define a line constraint.
member.param: if true, then the built-in tab key mode is available.
member.remarks: By default, use of the tab key is supported.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitElevatorMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Permit use of the control key to define a line constraint.
member.param: 0: no elevator modes are permitted 1: fixed plane elevator mode (like the Line command) 2: cplane elevator mode (like object dragging)

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitObjectSnap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, object snaps like "end", "near", etc. are controled by the user. If you want to disable this ability, then call PermitObjectSnap(false).
member.param: true to permit snapping to objects.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddSnapPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Add a point to the list of osnap points
member.returns: Total number of snap points
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints to specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddSnapPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Add points to the list of osnap points
member.returns: Total number of snap points
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints to specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddConstructionPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Add a point to the list of construction points
member.returns: Total number of construction points
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddConstructionPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Add points to the list of construction points
member.returns: Total number of construction points
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearSnapPoints
member.summary: Remove all snap points.
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints tp specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearConstructionPoints
member.summary: Remove all construction points
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.GetSnapPoints
member.summary: Get current snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.GetConstructionPoints
member.summary: Get current construction points
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapTangentBar(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls display of the curve snap tangent bar icon
member.param: true to draw a tangent bar icon whenever GetPoint snaps to a curve
true to draw points at the end of the tangent bar
member.remarks: The tangent bar is drawn by GetPoint::DynamicDraw. If you override GetPoint::DynamicDraw, then you must call the base class function.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapPerpBar(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls display of the curve snap perpendicular bar icon.
member.param: true to draw a tangent bar icon whenever GetPoint snaps to a curve
true to draw points at the end of the tangent bar

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapArrow(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls display of the curve snap arrow icon
member.param: true to draw arrow icon whenever GetPoint snaps to a curve
true if arrow icon direction should be the reverse of the first derivative direction
member.remarks: The tangent bar is drawn by GetPoint::DynamicDraw. If you override GetPoint::DynamicDraw, then you must call the base class function.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableSnapToCurves(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want GetPoint() to try to snap to curves when the mouse is near a curve (like the center point in the Circle command when the AroundCurve option is on), then enable the snap to curves option.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a line
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a line
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Arc)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on an arc
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Circle)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a circle
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Boolean)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a plane
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a sphere
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a cylinder
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Boolean)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a curve
member.param: defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Boolean)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a surface
member.param: defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Brep,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a brep
member.param: When wire_density<0, isocurve intersection snapping is turned off, when wire_density>=0, the value defines the isocurve density used for isocurve intersection snapping.
When face_index <0, constrain to whole brep. When face_index >=0, constrain to individual face.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainToConstructionPlane(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If enabled, the picked point is constrained to be on the active construction plane. If the base point is set, then the point is constrained to be on the plane that contains the base point and is parallel to the active construction plane. By default this constraint is enabled.
member.returns: if true and the base point is set, then the point is constrained to be on the plane parallel to the construction plane that passes through the base point, even when planar mode is off. If throughBasePoint is false, then the base point shift only happens if planar mode is on.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainToTargetPlane
member.summary: Constrain point to lie on a plane that is parallel to the viewing plane and passes through the view's target point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearConstraints
member.summary: Remove any explicit constraints added by calls to GetPoint::Constraint() and enable the built-in constraint options.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.InterruptMouseMove
member.summary: If you have lengthy computations in OnMouseMove() and/or DymanicDraw() overrides, then periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should interrupt your work because the mouse has moved again.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Get(System.Boolean)
member.summary: After setting up options and so on, call GetPoint::Get to get a 3d point
member.param: If false, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes down. If true, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes up.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Get
member.summary: After setting up options and so on, call GetPoint::Get to get a 3d point

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PointOnObject
member.summary: Call this function to see if the point was on an object. If the point was on an object an ObjRef is returned; otherwise null is returned

member.summary: Create an instance of a dictionary for writing to a 3dm archive

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of a dictionary for writing to a 3dm archive

member.summary: Read a dictionary from an archive.
member.param: The archive to read from. The archive position should be at the beginning of the dictionary

member.name: M:Rhino.Collections.ArchivableDictionary.Write(Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter)
member.summary: Write this dictionary to an archive

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveException
member.summary: Thrown by BinaryArchiveReader and BinaryArchiveWriter classes when an IO error has occured

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter.Archive3dmVersion
member.summary: If a 3dm archive is being read or written, then this is the version of the 3dm archive format (1, 2, 3, 4 or 5). 0 a 3dm archive is not being read/written 1 a version 1 3dm archive is being read/written 2 a version 2 3dm archive is being read/written 3 a version 3 3dm archive is being read/written 4 a version 4 3dm archive is being read/written 5 an old version 5 3dm archive is being read 50 a version 5 3dm archive is being read/written

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter.Write3dmChunkVersion(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A chunk version is a single byte that encodes a major.minor version number. Useful when creating I/O code for 3dm chunks that may change in the future. Increment the minor version number if new information is added to the end of the chunk. Increment the major version if the format of the chunk changes in some other way.
member.returns: true on successful read

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.Archive3dmVersion
member.summary: If a 3dm archive is being read or written, then this is the version of the 3dm archive format (1, 2, 3, 4 or 5). 0 a 3dm archive is not being read/written 1 a version 1 3dm archive is being read/written 2 a version 2 3dm archive is being read/written 3 a version 3 3dm archive is being read/written 4 a version 4 3dm archive is being read/written 5 an old version 5 3dm archive is being read 50 a version 5 3dm archive is being read/written

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.Read3dmChunkVersion(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: A chunk version is a single byte that encodes a major.minor version number. Useful when creating I/O code for 3dm chunks that may change in the future. Increment the minor version number if new information is added to the end of the chunk. Increment the major version if the format of the chunk changes in some other way.
member.returns: true on successful read

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.BeginReadDictionaryEntry(System.Int32@,System.String@)
member.returns: 0: serious IO error 1: success read information and then call EndReadDictionaryEntry() 2: at end of dictionary
