member.name: T:Rhino.Input.GetResult
member.summary: Possible results from GetObject.Input(), GetPoint.Input(), etc...

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Cancel
member.summary: User wants to cancel current command.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Nothing
member.summary: User pressed enter - typically used to accept defaults.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Option
member.summary: User specified an option - call Option() to get option index.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Number
member.summary: User entered a real number - call Number() to get value.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Color
member.summary: User entered a color - call Color() to get value.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Undo
member.summary: User pressed undo.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Miss
member.summary: User clicked and missed.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Point
member.summary: User picked 3d point - call Point() to get 3d point.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Point2d
member.summary: User picked 2d window point in CRhinoGetPoint::Get2dPoint() call ON_2dPoint() to get the point and View() to get the view.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Line2d
member.summary: User picked a 2d line in CRhinoGetPoint::Get2dLine() call Line2d() to get the line and View() to get the view.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Rectangle2d
member.summary: User picked a 2d rectangle in CRhinoGetPoint::Get2dRectangle() call Rectangle2d() to get the rectangle and View() to get the view.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Object
member.summary: User selected an object - call Object() to get object.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.String
member.summary: User typed a string - call String() to get the string.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.WindowsMessage
member.summary: Windows posted a message id that was in the list passed to RhinoGet::AcceptWindowsMessage(). Call CRhinoGet::WndMsg() to get the message.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Timeout
member.summary: The getter waited for the amount of time specifed in RhinoGet::SetWaitDuration() and then gave up.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Circle
member.summary: call CRhinoGetCircle::GetCircle() to get the circle.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Plane
member.summary: call CRhinoGetPlane::GetPlane() to get the plane.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Cylinder
member.summary: call CRhinoGetCylinder::GetCylinder() to get the cylinder.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Sphere
member.summary: call CRhinoGetSphere::GetSphere() to get the sphere.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Angle
member.summary: call CRhinoGetAngle::Angle() to get the angle in radians (CRhinoGetAngle() returns this for typed number, too).

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Distance
member.summary: call CRhinoGetDistance::Distance() to get the distance value.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Direction
member.summary: call CRhinoGetDirection::Direction() to get the direction vector.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Frame
member.summary: call CRhinoGetFrame::Frame() to get the frame that was picked.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.ExitRhino
member.summary: Stop now, do not cleaup, just return ASAP.

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass
member.summary: Base class for GetObject, GetPoint, GetSphere, etc. You will never directly create a GetBaseClass but you will use its member functions after calling GetObject.Gets(), GetPoint.Get(), and so on. Provides tools to set command prompt, set command options, and specify if the "get" can optionally accept numbers, nothing (pressing enter), and undo.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetCommandPrompt(System.String)
member.summary: Set prompt message that appears in the command prompt window.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetCommandPromptDefault(System.String)
member.summary: Set message that describes what default value will be used if the user presses enter. This description appears in angle brackets <> in the command prompt window. You do not need to provide a default value description unless you explicity enable AcceptNothing.
member.remarks: If you have a simple default point, number, or string, it is easier to use SetDefaultPoint, SetDefaultNumber, or SetDefaultString. SetCommandPromptDefault and AcceptNothing can be used for providing more advanced UI behavior.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Set a point as default value that will be returned if the user presses the ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultPoint will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses enter to accept the default point, GetResult.Point is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultPoint will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultNumber.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultNumber(System.Double)
member.summary: Set a number as default value that will be returned if the user presses ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultNumber will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses ENTER to accept the default number, GetResult.Number is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultNumber will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultInteger(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set a number as default value that will be returned if the user presses ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultInteger will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses ENTER to accept the default integer, GetResult.Number is returned and CRhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultNumber will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultString(System.String)
member.summary: Set a string as default value that will be returned if the user presses ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultString will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses ENTER to accept the default string, GetResult.String is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultString will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultNumber or SetDefaultPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultColor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Set a color as default value that will be returned if the user presses ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultColor will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses ENTER to accept the default color, GetResult.Color is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultColor will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetWaitDuration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the wait duration (in milliseconds) of the getter. If the duration passes without the user making a decision, the GetResult.Timeout code is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.ClearDefault
member.summary: Clears any defaults set using SetDefaultPoint, SetDefaultNumber, SetDefaultString, or SetCommandPromptDefault

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.GotDefault
member.summary: returns true if user pressed ENTER to accept a default point, number, or string set using SetDefaultPoint, SetDefaultNumber, or SetDefaultString.

option prompt shown if the user selects this option. If null or empty, then the option name is used as the get number prompt.

zero based index of current option

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.ClearCommandOptions
member.summary: Clear all command options

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.EnableTransparentCommands(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of transparent commands during the get.
member.param: If true, then transparent commands can be run during the get. If false, then transparent commands cannot be run during the get.
member.remarks: Some Rhino commands are "transparent" and can be run inside of other commands. Examples of transparent commands include the view manipulation commands like ZoomExtents, Top, etc., and the selection commands like SelAll, SelPoint, etc. By default transparent commands can be run during any get. If you want to disable this feature, then call EnableTransparentCommands(false) before calling GetString, GetPoint, GetObject, etc.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptNothing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to press enter in order to skip selecting a something in GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptNothing( true ) beforehand.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptUndo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to have an undo option in GetPoint.Get(), GetObject.GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptUndo(true) beforehand.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptNumber(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a number during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptNumber() beforehand. If the user chooses to type in a number, then the result code GetResult.Number is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Number() to get the value of the number. If you are using GetPoint and you want "0" to return (0,0,0) instead of the number zero, then set acceptZero = false.
member.param: If you are using GetPoint and you want "0" to return (0,0,0) instead of the number zero, then set acceptZero = false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptPoint(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a point then call AcceptPoint(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a number, then the result code GetResult.Point is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Point() to get the value of the point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptColor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a color r,g,b or name during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptColor(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a color, then the result code GetResult.Color is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Color() to get the value of the color. If the get accepts points, then the user will not be able to type in r,g,b colors but will be able to type color names.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a string during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptString(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a string, then the result code GetResult.String is returned and you can use RhinoGet.String() to get the value of the string.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Result
member.summary: returns result of the Get*() call

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.CommandResult
member.summary: Handy tool for getting command result value from getter results

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Number
member.summary: Used to get number if GetPoint.Get(), GetObject.GetObjects(), etc., returns GetResult.Number

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.StringResult
member.summary: Used to get string if GetPoint.Get(), GetObject.GetObjects(), etc., returns GetResult.String

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Point
member.summary: Used to get point if Get*() returns GetResult.Point

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Vector
member.summary: Used to get direction if Get*() returns GetResult.Point (Set by some digitizers, but in general it's (0,0,0)

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Color
member.summary: Used to get color if Get*() returns GetResult.Color

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.View
member.summary: Used to get view user clicked in during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject.GetObjects(), etc.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.PickRectangle
member.summary: If the get was a GetObjects() and the mouse was used to select the objects, then the returned rect has left < right and top < bottom. This rect is the Windows GDI screen coordinates of the picking rectangle. RhinoViewport.GetPickXform( pick_rect, pick_xform ) will calculate the picking transformation that was used. In all other cases, left=right=top=bottom=0;

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Point2d
member.summary: Returns location in view of point in selected in GetPoint::Get() or GetPoint::Get2dPoint(). (0,0) = upper left corner of window

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Rectangle2d
member.summary: Returns location in view of 2d rectangle selected in GetPoint::Get2dRectangle(). rect.left < rect.right and rect.top < rect.bottom (0,0) = upper left corner of window

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Line2d
member.summary: Returns two points defining location in view window of 2d line selected in GetPoint::Get2dLine(). (0,0) = upper left corner of window

member.returns: true if string can be used as an option name

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.CommandLineOption.IsValidOptionValueName(System.String)
member.summary: Test a string to see if it can be used as an option value in RhinoGet::AddCommandOption, RhinoGet::AddCommandOptionToggle, or RhinoGet::AddCommandOptionList.
member.returns: true if string can be used as an option value

member.name: P:Rhino.UI.StackedDialogPage.PageControl
member.summary: Return the control that represents this page. This will typically be a custom user control.

member.name: P:Rhino.UI.StackedDialogPage.ShowDefaultsButton
member.summary: Called when this page is activated.
member.returns: true : if the page wants the "Defaults" button to appear. false : if the page does not want the "Defaults" button to appear. Default returns false Note: returning false implies that OnDefaults() method will never get called.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.StackedDialogPage.OnApply
member.summary: Called when stacked dialog OK button is pressed
member.returns: If return value is true then the dialog will be closed. A return of false means there was an error and dialog remains open so page can be properly updated.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.StackedDialogPage.OnCancel
member.summary: Called when stacked dialog Cancel button is pressed.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.StackedDialogPage.OnActivate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when this page is activated/deactivated.
member.param: If true then this page is on top otherwise it is about to be hidden.
member.returns: If true then the page is hidden and the requested page is not activated otherwise will not allow you to change the current page. Default returns true

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.StackedDialogPage.OnDefaults
member.summary: Called when stacked dialog Defaults button is pressed (see ShowDefaultsButton).

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SweepOneRail
member.summary: Utility class for generating breps by sweeping cross section curves over a rail curve

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SweepOneRail.ClosedSweep
member.summary: If the input rail is closed, ClosedSweep determines if the swept breps will also be closed.

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.ReadSettings
member.summary: Reads existing settings for a plugin and its associated commands. Clears the dirty flag for the settings.
member.returns: True if settings are successfully read. False if there was no existing settings file to read, or if a read lock could not be acquired.

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.WriteSettings
member.summary: Flushes the current settings to the user's roaming directory. If an xml file for the guid already exists, it attempts to update the file in order to maintain comments, etc. If the xml is corrupt or the file does not exist, it writes out a new file.
member.returns: True if settings where flushed to disk, otherwise false.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.RhinoView
member.summary: A RhinoView represents a single "window" display of a document. A view could contain one or many RhinoViewports (many in the case of Layout views with detail viewports). Standard Rhino modeling views have one viewport

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the size and location of the view including its nonclient elements, in pixels, relative to the parent control.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.ClientRectangle
member.summary: Gets the rectangle that represents the client area of the view.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.EnableDrawing
member.summary: Enables drawing. By default, drawing is enabled. There are some rare situations where scipts want to disable drawing for a while.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.MainViewport
member.summary: A RhinoView contains a "main viewport" that fills the entire view client window. RhinoPageViews may also contain nested child RhinoViewports for implementing detail viewports. The MainViewport will always return this RhinoView's m_vp

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.ActiveViewport
member.summary: The ActiveViewport is the same as the MainViewport for standard RhinoViews. In a RhinoPageView, the active viewport may be the RhinoViewport of a child detail object. Most of the time, you will use ActiveViewport unless you explicitly need to work with the main viewport.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.ActiveViewportID
member.summary: Returns viewport ID for the active viewport. Faster than ActiveViewport function when working with page views.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.TitleVisible
member.summary: Visibility of the viewport title window

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.IsFloatingRhinoView
member.summary: Used by Rhino main frame and doc/view manager to determine if this view is in a floating frame or a child of the MDIClient window associated with the Rhino main frame window. Returns true If this view is in a free floating frame window.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.Redraw
member.summary: Redraw this view
member.remarks: If you change something in "this" view like the projection, construction plane, background bitmap, etc., then you need to call RhinoView.Redraw() to redraw "this" view./ The other views will not be changed. If you change something in the document (like adding new geometry to the model), then you need to call RhinoDoc.Views.Redraw() to redraw all the views.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.CreateWireframePreviewImage(System.String,System.Drawing.Size,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a bitmap preview image of model.
member.param: [in] The name of the bitmap file to create. The extension of the imagePath controls the format of the bitmap file created (bmp, tga, jpg, pcx, png, tif).
[in] The width and height of the bitmap in pixels.
member.returns: true if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.CreateShadedPreviewImage(System.String,System.Drawing.Size,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a bitmap preview image of model.
member.param: [in] The name of the bitmap file to create. The extension of the imagePath controls the format of the bitmap file created (bmp, tga, jpg, pcx, png, tif).
[in] The width and height of the bitmap in pixels.
member.returns: true if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.FloatRhinoView(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change floating state of RhinoView
member.param: if true, then the view will be in a floating frame window. Otherwise the view will be embeded in the main frame
member.returns: true on success

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ParentView
member.summary: Gets the parent view, if there is one Every RhinoView has an associated RhinoViewport that does all the 3d display work. Those associated viewports return the RhinoView as their parent view. However, RhinoViewports are used in other image creating contexts that do not have a parent RhinoView. If you call ParentView, you MUST check for NULL return values.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.Id
member.summary: Unique id for this viewport

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ChangeCounter
member.summary: The value of change counter is incremented every time the view projection or construction plane changes. The user can the mouse and nestable view manipulation commands to change a view at any time. The value of change counter can be used to detect these changes in code that is sensitive to the view projection.

member.summary: name associated with this viewport

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: returns true if some portion world coordinate bounding box is potentially visible in the viewing frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: returns true if some portion world coordinate point is potentially visible in the viewing frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetScreenSize(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the size of the RhinoViewport

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetClippingPlanes(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Set optimal clipping planes to view objects in a world coordinate 3d bounding box

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetCameraTarget(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set viewport target point. By default the camera location is translated so that the camera direction vector is parallel to the vector from the camera location to the target location.
member.param: if true, the camera location is translated so that the camera direction vector is parallel to the vector from the camera location to the target location. If false, the camera location is not changed.
member.remarks: In general, Rhino users expect to have the camera direction vector and the vector from the camera location to the target location to be parallel. If you use the RhinoViewport functions to set the camera location, camera direction, and target point, then the relationship between these three points and vectors is automatically maintained. If you directly manipulate the camera properties, then you should carefully set the target by calling SetTarget() with updateCameraLocation=false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetCameraLocations(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Set viewport camera location and target location. The camera direction vector is changed so that it is parallel to the vector from the camera location to the target location.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetCameraLocation(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set viewport camera location. By default the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction vector.
member.param: if true, the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction vector. If false, the target location is not changed. See the remarks section of RhinoViewport.SetTarget for important details.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetCameraDirection(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set viewport camera direction. By default the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction.
member.param: if true, the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction. If false, the target location is not changed. See the remarks section of RhinoViewport.SetTarget for important details.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetConstructionPlane(Rhino.DocObjects.ConstructionPlane)
member.summary: Sets the construction plane to cplane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.PushConstructionPlane(Rhino.DocObjects.ConstructionPlane)
member.summary: Pushes the current construction plane on the viewport's construction plane stack and sets the construction plane to cplane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.PopConstructionPlane
member.summary: Sets the construction plane to the plane that was active before the last call to PushConstructionPlane.
member.returns: true if a construction plane was popped

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.NextConstructionPlane
member.summary: Sets the construction plane to the plane that was active before the last call to PreviousConstructionPlane.
member.returns: true if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.PreviousConstructionPlane
member.summary: Sets the construction plane to the plane that was active before the last call to NextConstructionPlane or SetConstructionPlane.
member.returns: true if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetProjection(Rhino.Display.DefinedViewportProjection,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set viewport to a defined projection
member.param: if not null or empty, the name is set
if true, the construction plane is set to the viewport plane
member.returns: true if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.PushViewProjection
member.summary: Appends the current view projection and target to the viewport's view stack.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.PopViewProjection
member.summary: Sets the view projection and target to the settings at the top of the view stack and removes those settings from the view stack.
member.returns: true if there were settings that could be popped from the stack

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.NextViewProjection
member.summary: Sets the view projection and target to the settings that were active before the last call to PrevView.
member.returns: true if the view stack was popped

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.PreviousViewProjection
member.summary: Sets the view projection and target to the settings that were active before the last call to NextViewProjection.
member.returns: true if the view stack was popped

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ZoomExtents
member.summary: Dolly the camera location and so that the view frustum contains all of the selected document objects that can be seen in view. If the projection is perspective, the camera angle is not changed.
member.returns: true if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ZoomExtentsSelected
member.summary: Dolly the camera location and so that the view frustum contains all of the selected document objects that can be seen in view. If the projection is perspective, the camera angle is not changed.
member.returns: true if successful

member.summary: Zooms the viewport to the given bounding box
member.returns: true if successful

member.summary: Rotate viewport around target

member.summary: Keyboard arrow key interaction tool

If less than 0, rotation is to left or down. If greater than 0, rotation is to right or up

member.summary: Keyboard arrow key interaction tool

member.param: false = perform a "dolly" magnification by moving the camera towards/away from the target so that the amount of the screen subtended by an object changes. true = perform a "zoom" magnification by adjusting the "lens" angle

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.Magnify(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Point)
member.param: false = perform a "dolly" magnification by moving the camera towards/away from the target so that the amount of the screen subtended by an object changes. true = perform a "zoom" magnification by adjusting the "lens" angle

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ClientToScreenPort(System.Drawing.Point@)
member.summary: Convert a point in parent RhinoView client window coordinates to the Viewport screen port client coordinates. The screen port of a RhinoViewport may not match the client area of the parent RhinoView. This occurs in cases when the RhinoViewport is a nested child viewport
member.param: point in client coordinates of parent RhinoView window as input. This is converted to the screen port client coordinates of the viewport as output
member.returns: true if the point is inside of the RhinoViewport's screen port rectangle

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.Rotate(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Rotates about the specified axis. A positive rotation angle results in a counter-clockwise rotation about the axis (right hand rule).
member.param: direction of the axis of rotation
point on the axis of rotation
member.returns: true if geometry successfully rotated

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetCameraFrame(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Returns true if current camera orientation is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetFrustumCenter(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Returns world coordinates of frustum's center
member.returns: true if the center was successfully computed

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetDepth(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double@)
member.summary: Get clipping distance of a point
member.returns: True if the point is ing the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. False if the bounding box does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetDepth(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Get near and far clipping distances of a bounding box
member.returns: True if the bounding box intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. False if the bounding box does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetDepth(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Get near and far clipping distances of a sphere
member.returns: True if the sphere intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. False if the sphere does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetFrustumNearPlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Get near clipping plane
member.param: near clipping plane if camera and frustum are valid. The plane's frame is the same as the camera's frame. The origin is located at the intersection of the camera direction ray and the near clipping plane.
member.returns: true if camera and frustum are valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetFrustumFarPlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Get far clipping plane
member.param: far clipping plane if camera and frustum are valid. The plane's frame is the same as the camera's frame. The origin is located at the intersection of the camera direction ray and the far clipping plane.
member.returns: true if camera and frustum are valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetFrustumLeftPlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Get left world frustum clipping plane
member.param: frustum left side clipping plane. The normal points into the visible region of the frustum. If the projection is perspective, the origin is at the camera location, otherwise the origin isthe point on the plane that is closest to the camera location.
member.returns: True if camera and frustum are valid and plane was set

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.GetFrustumRightPlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)

member.param: frustum right side clipping plane. The normal points into the visible region of the frustum. If the projection is perspective, the origin is at the camera location, otherwise the origin isthe point on the plane that is closest to the camera location.
member.returns: True if camera and frustum are valid and plane was set

member.summary: Get bottom world frustum clipping plane
member.param: frustum bottom side clipping plane. The normal points into the visible region of the frustum. If the projection is perspective, the origin is at the camera location, otherwise the origin isthe point on the plane that is closest to the camera location.
member.returns: True if camera and frustum are valid and plane was set
